name: Alice Borderland
review_text: The worst skiing experience. They had many unfair contract terms and would not refund their customers under many circumstances such as not being able to get a parking or closures of chairlifts due to adverse weather (they will keep their t-bars running to make sure they're still in operation).  Some of the chairlifts around the green slopes do not slow down before people get off and it's very dangerous coz people keep falling down and block the path. I've seen a few preventable injuries due to this ill operation and talked to the staff about it but it seems like the management refused to spend extra effort to deal with it. It seems to be the users fault at this resort all the time.

name: Sydney Sider
review_text:
Absolutely an amazing place. I am from Canada and was so happy to see white snow and beautiful blue sky on top of a snowy mountain  in Australia. Wonderful experience and want to go back.

Be prepared for warm spring like skiing and snowboarding with icy bits in morning and evening and heavy snow in mid day heat. Love every minute of it!!!

name: Peter Kawecki
review_text: Perisher picked us up in their shuttle when we were walking with kids 1km from our parking spot to the fields on a busy weekend. Saved a huge hassle.

name: Anthony Jay Caronongan
review_text: Snow? HELL YEAH

name: Jarrod
review_text:
The best ski resort in Australia.
Lots of missed opportunities and more potential. Potentially blocked by National Parks and Government.
Major issues with parking with no real plan to address the issue.

name: Nikolai Pitchforth
review_text: The food is expensive, the parking limited, public transport very expensive, the location a long way from anywhere... But it's snow! In Australia! Terrain not very varied but lots of lifts and expansive area.

name: Jacob Hawkins
review_text:
DODGY DODGY DODGY. OWNED BY VAIL AND SAME AS MT HOTHAM!!!!

HOTHAM ENCOURAGES YOU TO SKI WHILE ILL! THEY DO NOT OFFER ANY REFUNDS FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE UNWELL AND UNABLE TO SKI AND ENCOURAGE YOU TO VISIT WHILE ILL!

Hotham is a dodgy resort operated by the company Vail which is a company with no interest in people's wellbeing. Structured to avoid complaints I watched several people be rejected by Hotham to go deal with Epic and Hotham actively didn't help several paying customers with issues with there lessons while I watched and was also not helped...

I recently took a family trip to Hotham. My 11 month old daughter contracted gastro while visiting and we had to go to hospital on our first night. The local nurse and doctors told us that there was a fairly large and severe gastro outbreak causing people to present at hospital and many were coming from Hotham. No such warning from the resort though.

When I was unable to utilise my ski lifts and lessons they refused to provide me a refund and said I had to be sick for over 30 days for them to provide a refund.

I am not wealthy and am a disability support worker and when a company who makes that much money doesn't provide a refund for services they didn't provide I see red. I cannot afford another trip to Hotham and they made it absolutely clear that they would prefer me to ski and spread the sickness than to come to any fair conclusions. As a result I went skiing on the last day after they refused my refund and informed everyone I could that I was unwell and to keep a distance.

They don't care if there resorts make no money, if they ruin pristine natural environments and charge exorbitant fees for lift tickets and offer no refunds if you do not use them due to sickness. They charge $150 a day for those lift tickets and they run regardless. Dodgy as. Skiing cost me about $400 a day from lift tickets to gear hire and lessons and I just hoped to recouped $150 per day of that but they refuse. ACCC here I come.

I will leave a review like this on every Vail resort every week until they respond and I will keep smashing them with complaints and everything I can. Dodgy, dodgy dodgy....

name: Guilherme
review_text: Just wonderfull place, but yet too expensive for the lift

name: Shahrouz Goharshahi
review_text: Perisher is fantastic for all ages and groups, but especially wonderful for families with young children and toddlers. There are plenty of safe areas where you can pull over and let the kids enjoy the snow, build snowmen, and play without being near the crowds. It made the whole experience stress-free and so much fun. A perfect family snow holiday!

name: Bill Filson
review_text: A good place to start a backcountry ski trip up Rock Creek and away from the crowded downhill slopes. The car park get full very quickly and it is best to arrived no later than 7:30am.

review_text: Absolutely stunning views, great for kids as it has the toboggan area. Beginner and children friendly, large carparks with indoor food court area.

review_text: One of the localised places on the hill, ski in ski out (sort of). Beer and food at amusement Park prices, its got a a few options for food and drinks, chinese middle Eastern. Cafe. Plenty of seating. Pool tables. Bathrooms. I didnt stay in any of the rooms, but it looks OK.

name: Martin Stones
review_text:
Very disappointed with Vail Resorts.
Customer service is terrible.
Tried to talk to someone in management. They now only have AI chat bots to talk to. No phone number. And there offices have been closed down.
What's life coming to when you can't speak to a human and only AI is available.
Another gripe is that Perisher is short staffed. Cafes often have a 45 minute wait for a coffee.
Perisher took over all of the private run food on the mountain. Now close the places at a drop of a hat.
The mountain is not the same.
Also the maintenance of lifts, buildings, toilets doesn't happen.
The place is falling apart. Afraid of a major incident occurring on a lift.

name: Lenny Road
review_text: Vail ripping the country off

name: THIEN HUONG LE VU
review_text: I has just come Perisher Ski Resort. I like this place so much. I am Vietnamese. The frist time I visit Perisher

name: Dennis S
review_text:
Vail group has made it clear that you should not expect any refund to costs in the event that you get sick or injured while visiting.

My child got sick and missed 30% of her trip.

Vail has refused a credit for this period as it was both after the start date and she was well enough to finish the trip.

Might need to look at alternatives in VIC for future trips if this is the 'service' given when issues occur.

name: Brendan V (BaconSupanova)
review_text: Absolutely criminal pricing for snow lift passes. You should be ashamed.

name: leizel Mantala
review_text: Highly recommended! Me and my family had a fantastic time at Perisher Ski Resort. The facilities were great, and the snow was perfect for all skill levels. I'd especially like to commend the exceptional service at the Perisher Valley Visitor Information Centre. Elise was incredibly helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable -- she went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. Her assistance made a real difference to our trip. Thank you, Elise!

name: Rachel Tanny
review_text: As a single parent, I saved and sacrificed a lot to be able to afford the expensive lift tickets so my kids could spend one day at Perisher skiing with their friend for my son's birthday present.  However, we were told there was no parking, which apparently happens a lot and they know it happens but don't say anything about it on the website or warn you when you purchase tickets.  Due to a medical condition, taking a bus as an alternative was NOT possible.  They were NOT allowed to enter even to drop off the kids to ski! So the lift passes could NOT be used! Perisher is IMPOSSIBLE to contact as they do NOT HAVE A WORKING PHONE NUMBER. Even Experion does not have a valid phone number. Their online chat was useless and unhelpful.  They said they would send an email with information but never did.  Perisher is a SCAM!!! It ruined my kids' holiday, which they were looking forward to all year, and I saved and sacrificed so much to be able to provide them! This is a SCAM and a FRAUD!!!! NEVER GO TO PERISHER, NEVER BOOK LIFT PASSES WITH THEM!!!!!!!! YOU WILL WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY AND BE LEFT WITH ONLY TEARS AND DISAPPOINTMENT!

name: Lachlan McKenzie
review_text: I think Perisher does a good job given the constraints nature deals it.  But they do need to provide more parking. It would be great if they invested in more wind tolerant lifts and more toilets.

name: Awe Some
review_text: My mother is a single mother and she saved and saved up money for a whole year and when my birthday finally came, we couldn't even get in because they had closed of the car park and we couldn't get in. I was so sad and they never gave us a refund. It completely ruined my birthday and all we could do after that was drive all the way back to Sydney.

name: Riccardo Sansone
review_text:
My experience at Perisher was unfortunately the worst I've had at any ski resort.

I had pre booked my snow gear (board and boots) online, yet I still had to wait in the same queue as everyone else, with no dedicated line for online bookings and an insufficient number of staff at the pick up counters. This completely defeats the purpose of booking ahead and reflects poor service management.

Additionally, I've never been to a ski resort where the lifts have no leg rests. This felt unsafe for both children and adults, especially as the safety bars kept lifting unexpectedly. Having to carry the snowboard attached to my foot caused significant knee pain, which lasted for days.

name: Shelley Ligtermoet
review_text: Incredible ski destination with well-groomed runs and stunning scenery. There's something for every skill level, and the facilities are excellent. Always a great experience.

name: Liban Kasimyare Mohamed
review_text:
Subject: Safety Concern at Perisher Ski Resort

Dear Perisher Ski Resort Team,

I'm writing this review in the hope that it prompts some changes to improve safety on the slopes. Currently, it appears that anyone -- including those who have never skied before -- can simply arrive at the resort, rent equipment from outside vendors, park, walk in, and head straight to the lifts without any skill check or guidance.

There seems to be no procedure or regulation in place to ensure that visitors have at least basic skiing or snowboarding skills before accessing the slopes. This lack of oversight increases the risk of injury -- not only to inexperienced individuals but also to others on the mountain.

For example, a young lady had a loose snowboard hit her spine while she was sitting and listening to her instructor. The owner of the board had no idea how to ride it or how to place it face down so it doesn't slide down the slope and hit someone.

I strongly suggest introducing a process to verify that all guests have at least basic ability before they're allowed on certain slopes. Even a quick assessment or dedicated beginner check-in area could go a long way toward preventing accidents and making the resort safer for everyone.

Overall, I had a great time :).

Thank you for considering this feedback.

review_text: Apalling service from the Rental team. Was charged for faulty lockers that didn't work, when requested  a refund at the store I was asked to send an email. They do not reply any emails and many people have been affected. Do not use these lockers, it is a scam.

name: Gert Jerm
review_text:
Warning to Perisher Ski Resort Visitors: Please Do Not Leave Equipment Unattended - No Security Provided

Two orange toboggans we rented from Boss Sports Hire Jindabyne were stolen at Perisher Ski Resort. Despite our efforts, including seeking assistance from staff like Winston, we were told there were no cameras and no help available.

Boss Sports Hire charged an additional $80 for each lost toboggan, which we found unreasonable.

Nevertheless, I appreciate the helpful response from Boss Sports recently in July 2025 particularly that we can take our equipment into the Perisher Resort food court to avoid losing our equipment.

Future visitors, beware: do not leave any skis or toboggans unattended, even briefly, as there is no security provided by Perisher Resort. They do not allow these items into their food court, yet offer no means to secure them. I advise against eating here and supporting this establishment, as the staff seemed more concerned with profit than customer care, except for the kind assistance from Leighanne.

JMJ God Bless.

name: Miha Grilj
review_text:
Massive Terrain, But Expect the Crowds

Perisher is a truly massive resort and offers an incredible amount of terrain, making it a fantastic destination for all levels of skiers and snowboarders. The sheer scale and variety of runs are its greatest strengths; you could spend days here without skiing the same run twice. From the beginner-friendly slopes to the more challenging black diamond runs and well-maintained terrain parks, there's a huge amount to explore.

However, the size of Perisher also brings its biggest challenge: the crowds. On busy weekends and during peak season, the lift lines can get quite long, especially at popular chairlifts, which can eat into your ski time. While the lift network is extensive, some of the older lifts can also be a bit slow. The atmosphere is vibrant and lively, but it can sometimes feel more focused on volume than on providing a charming, boutique experience.

Overall, if you're looking for the largest amount of terrain in Australia and can plan your visit to avoid the peak crowds, Perisher is an excellent choice. It's a huge mountain with great potential, but a few operational improvements could easily push it to a full 5 stars.

name: Brian Bett

Her attitude was unprofessional and came across as discriminatory. I expected respectful and courteous service. Management should seriously reconsider who they have representing their business at such a key location.

review_text: Perisher ski resort is amazing but very icy and dangerous for amateurs. The food hall is too too crowded and no option for Vegan people.

name: K
review_text:
UPDATE: 2025 and it just keeps getting worse. The peak season dates (more costly lift ticket pricing), which has for decades incorporated NSW school holiday's, has now been extended by two weeks to cover QLD school holidays... all of course whilst the risk of insufficient snow coverage is greatest.

I've been skiing at Perisher and Smiggins since 2000 and have skied overseas in Cardrona (NZ) multiple times. Perisher and Smiggins have made next to no updates in all this time. Car parking has always been grossly inadequate. There is insufficient seating and space capacity considering the volumes of patrons (people who have paid thousands to ski/board there) they allow entry too. The food is grossly overpriced and low quality and services understaffed by rude, unfriendly, unprofessionally dressed/presented, disengaged, obnoxious 20 somethings. Tables are not wiped clean between customers or rubbish disposed off... absolutely unacceptable given the past two years of Convid, in which this resort loved virtue signalling just how much they "care about health". Bathroom facilities are absolutely disgusting .. not cleaned and rubbish all over floors.

Lifts are not built for the average season conditions - particularly wind. Lifts are continually on wind hold, forcing people to cram onto a few available lifts and wait 45 minutes to an hour or more to get on a chair lift. We love parking at Smiggins, as you can park right by the entrance of the far right building near the j bars and use them to access to link t-bar and ski to Perisher.But NO.... the past 3 years in a row Perisher REFUSED to open the link t-bar, meaning you have to either park at Perisher and walk significant distances from the car park, or use the shuttle bus. Lifts to Blue Cow were closed while we were there this season and Perisher had the nerve to advise patrons to use the ski tube instead, but then operated it in a reduced schedule, claiming (the underground skitube train) was impacted by strong winds. It's an endless money grab by Perisher!!!

The resorts in NZ are superior in every way.

name: Leo Teng
review_text: Great slopes and lifts, lots of people, it all really depends on the weather to determine how good your trip is.

name: Sydney's world

name: Mac Lim
review_text:
A large interconnected Ski Resort with a variety of terrain difficulties and beautiful views.

During my most recent visit (15/7/25 to 18/7/25), conditions varied from frigid, windy and snowing to beautiful and sunny as seen in the attached photos. Snow levels were approximately 160cm at peak. Ski seasons are very variable in Australia due to climatic patterns and the effects of climate change.

The new Mount Perisher 6 Chair is very comfortable and significantly quicker than the chairs it replaces. A welcome upgrade.

Food on the mountain is expensive as you would expect from a Ski Resort but is generally okay with some particularly good restaurants available (See other reviews).

Crowds can be intense during the School Holidays and this period should be avoided if possible. Perisher staff are usually deployed to manage crowds. Avoid beginner slopes if possible as these will be more crowded.

name: Renee Takyi
review_text: Perisher offers a large snow covered area to ski & play in. We built a snow man & went taboganning for about an hour, then looked around only to find the only other thing to do was eat & drink with some live band that was playing in a couple of buildings. One place had a fireplace and pool table. But the place was so packed there were no seats. Perisher has over commercialised buildings, ppl stacked in like sardines, no atmosphere for visitors. Ski tube a rip off & old battleaxe train, signage not great at resort. Good for skiiers & snowboarders.. not much else to offer. The resort is focused around skiing & snowboarding. So is the ski tube.. no comfort. They shut the roads when the carpark gets full so you are forced to pay $149 per person for the ski tube & you can't even see out the window!

name: J W
review_text: We do the skiing once a year during the last 9 years, never experienced the full capacity (due to the parking). When we arrived at 12pm on Saturday, we got advised by the police that it was full. We heard the situation is based on one car out followed by one car in.  I can see many cars were leaving Perisher Valley Resort, but no car was allowed to go in. I was so frustrated with the situation as I have already bought the lift tickets for the whole family. We went to the restaurant near the checkpoint for lunch and resting. At around 2pm, suddenly it was allowed to go in. We were lucky to be in the first group to drive in. When we arrived at the Perisher Valley Ski Resort, it was so easy to find parking, inside the rest area where people eat and rest, it was less busy as well. I struggle to appreciate the reasoning of denying the access for a few hours. Totally unnecessary. In the past the ski resort was much busier, never denying people for access. I tried to email Perisher Ski Resort to check if it was possible to transfer the lift pass from day time to evening time, unfortunately no response. On Sunday, we deliberately got there early just in case of denied access due to the full capacity. Luckily I didn't see the police checkpoint. When arrived at Perisher Ski Resort, it was very difficult to find parking. It took me over 35 minutes. Overall I did enjoy the beautiful moments on the snow, but not a good experience in terms of denied access on Saturday.

review_text:
We didn't stay at the resort but we dined at Smiggin holes for lunch and arvo tea.
It is our 3rd time here and always convenient. Food prices are reasonable with fair variety. Kid friendly. The coffees were good too.
Our kids only toboggan and thats the best bit about Smiggin Holes, they havent banned it.
Looking forward to coming back next year for some snowboarding lessons!

name: Manjunath Malsani
review_text:
Perisher Valley is absolutely magical - the snowfall was incredible and the kids had an amazing time playing in the snow. It's a winter wonderland and truly a beautiful spot for a snow holiday.

However, I would not recommend visiting during the peak school holiday season. The traffic was completely out of control. By 8:30 AM, the resort parking was full and thousands of cars were being turned back, with no prior updates or warnings. We saw the same chaos at Thredbo as well.

We ended up losing our bookings - and a lot of money - due to this poor management. There's a serious lack of infrastructure and communication to handle peak crowds. It's clear the area hasn't been upgraded to support the number of visitors it receives during holidays.

Go for the snow and scenery - it's worth it - but avoid the peak season unless you're prepared for a logistical nightmare.

name: Hayley Dinh
review_text:
Extremely poor experience for beginners - Smiggin Holes Ski School should not advertise beginner lessons if they don't support first-timers.

I booked a beginner group lesson at Smiggin Holes (Perisher), which included a mandatory lift pass. I received no instruction, no help, and the instructor didn't take us to the lift. As a first-time skier, I was completely lost and left alone.

When I asked staff why we weren't taken to the lift, they told me it was because I didn't ask. That response is completely unacceptable -- how is a beginner supposed to know what to ask for?

I couldn't use the lift pass, didn't receive a lesson, and was denied a refund. I didn't even get a receipt, and all complaints were handled verbally with no accountability. Staff said they weren't responsible for the instructor -- shocking.

This felt like a scam. I paid a lot of money for nothing. If you're a beginner, do NOT go to Smiggin Holes Ski School. They are absolutely not prepared to support first-timers.

name: Tony Attallah
review_text: Our group had era beautiful  time there, great facilities fo

name: Antonio Sarkis

name: Nadia Afrin (Nadia)
review_text:
2025 ,13th July - We went yesterday, expecting it to be a 2.5-hour drive from Canberra, but it ended up taking us 4.5 hours due to heavy road congestion. First, we were redirected from Perisher to Thredbo with claims that Thredbo had parking available. But when we arrived there, they told us to go back to Perisher or take the Ski Tube instead.

When we returned to Perisher, they refused us entry, saying only guests with ski resort bookings were allowed in. Honestly, what kind of capitalist setup is this? It was a complete waste of time, energy, and money. I'm never going back--and I'll be telling my friends to avoid this place too.

name: W G
review_text:
Disappointed experience. The kids' ski lesson was poorly run -- the instructor barely taught anything, and there was no feedback or follow-up. We were also forced to buy a lift ticket for the lesson, even though beginners don't use the lift. It feels like unfair bundling.

Non-skiers in our group bought lift tickets too, but weren't allowed to ride the lift without ski gear -- this wasn't mentioned on the website, so we wasted over $400.

name: Karan Sandhu
review_text: Great place

name: Muhammad Awais
review_text: very Very beautiful  place

name: i-smart Chan
review_text: Good

name: Shane Leite
review_text:
We visited Perisher last week and found it overwhelmingly busy. Lift pass queues were frustratingly long, and once on the slopes, the heavy traffic made it difficult to enjoy the snow. It often felt crowded rather than relaxed, which took away from the overall experience.

Another surprise was the lack of facilities -- there weren't many places to sit down, put on boots, or get sorted before hitting the slopes. Even something as simple as more benches or undercover areas would go a long way.

For family members who aren't skiing, it was hard to find a comfortable spot to sit, stay warm, and just enjoy the mountain atmosphere. A quiet area to read a book or take in the view would've made a real difference.

Perisher has a great location, but the crowding and lack of practical amenities made this visit less enjoyable than we'd hoped.

name: Rahul Krish
review_text: Snow much fun ! On Saturday we got the chance to see fireworks. You can hire snow gear and get passes for traing  skiing. You can hire toboggan from Rythm signings. Entry fee for the car is $30. We had lot of fun.

name: Monica Kim
review_text: Our family booked ski lessons at Perisher, and we had a 2-hour session with a lovely instructor named Ashley, who came all the way from Scotland. She was really nice and did a fantastic job managing even our 6-year-old boy, helping us all enjoy skiing in such a short time. It was a truly meaningful experience, and I'd like to express our gratitude to Ashley once again!

name: Kym Cavanagh
review_text: Great snow this year, fantastic runs, beautiful weather

name: Noah Silveira
review_text:
Was a great ski  experience. There are a lot of people during season time that's a challenge for young inexperienced skiers.
Great open spot available for tobogganing.

name: Corno Badenhorst
review_text: Great but totally overpriced.

name: CHRISTIAN UNITED
review_text:
I would like to share a disappointing experience I had at Perisher Resort.

Yesterday, I purchased a morning lift ticket at around 11:00 AM from the ticket counter. The staff did not inform me that this ticket was only valid until 1:00 PM, and that it might be better to purchase an afternoon pass instead due to the time.

Later, I realized the limited validity of the morning ticket and returned to ask if I could change to an afternoon ticket. I was told this was not possible, and that I would have to pay an extra $34 for a full-day ticket.

After reading through the lift ticket terms and conditions on the official Perisher website (as shown in the attached image), I couldn't find any policy that explicitly prohibits changing the time slot for a same-day ticket -- especially when the ticket was purchased shortly before the morning session ended.

I believe this miscommunication cost me an extra $270 unnecessarily, and could have been avoided with a simple explanation or recommendation from the staff.

As someone who does not speak English fluently and was visiting Perisher for the first time alone, I feel that the staff should have made the situation clearer.

I hope Perisher Resort can improve the communication and ticketing process to help guests -- especially international visitors -- make more informed choices.

Thank you for your understanding.

name: Daniel Riddle
review_text: Had a good time skiing, although weather and snow conditions were not great. would be nice to come back on a better day.

name: Rory Bill
review_text: Expensive but good

name: KK R
review_text: We had a fantastic family trip to the Perisher valley mountain! The kids loved tobogganing down gentle slopes and building snowmen. There were easy trails perfect for beginner skiers, and we even had a short ski lesson together. The snow play area was safe and well managed, with lots of space to run around. We enjoyed hot chocolate in the warm cafe while watching the snow fall. The views were stunning, and everything was well organised for families. It was a great place to make winter memories, and we can't wait to come back next year for more snow fun! Of all, kids had a great time and are keen to do more skiing.

name: Amber Montz
review_text: Beautiful location had plenty of snow. I wish there was an area with a big fireplace or something to warm up as it was so cold! The lodge area was not heated so there was little reprieve from the cold and limited food options.

review_text: I came to perisher to ski for the first time, but I found it was quite overpriced for lift tickets and  rentals. The lack of signs made it hard to find your way around, especially if you've never been there before. They had lots of options from first timers to very experienced skiers/boarders. The food places were way overpriced and pretty average tasting. Most restaurants didn't even accept cash. It was fun but not great value. Also, I don't recommend toboganning here as they don't have a conveyor belt to get back up the hill, so it was very tiring climbing back up.

review_text: Easy to get to on the bus. Lots of people and a real buzz. Don't take your car, the lot is full before 7am. Stay at Jindabyne if you're doing a cheap holiday. The resorts are $$$$$.

Disappointing experience

name: James Auswild
review_text: Cant beat Thredbo eh.

name: Arvind Baswan
review_text: I read in one of the reviews "this place is called perisher because your money just perishes here!" lol.. So true! We visited Perisher Ski Resort this weekend (21/06/25) I booked Ski lessons for my 11 year old daughter and myself. I was annoyed to find out after forking out for the expensive lessons ($280 in total). They said you can't join a ski lesson unless you pay for ski lift. The whole point of taking a lesson is you can't use the ski lift because you are a beginner! I had to fork our another $280 to use a travelator they call magic carpet (not ski lift) because it was essential part of the lesson. Thankfully, they cordoned the kids area so to filter out the rush. But if you taking adult lessons, you would need to queue-up and wait 20 mins to get on the bloody "magic carpet". I told the lady in the office as well, their "policy" was a big time rip-off. When someone is already paying for the lessons, travelator use should be included in your ticket. I can understand, if people feel confident they can buy ski lift pass separately. But to join your beginner lesson you shouldn't try to rip-off as customers have already paid for the instructor time and use of the facility. Anyone reading this review, if you are a beginner, and want lessons. Go to Mt. Selwyn, which is where I would be heading next time.

review_text: The resort is huge with an abundance of runs. That's about all it has going for it. Ticket prices (not to mention food prices on the hill) are exorbitant. Service is terrible, with most staff clearly not too happy to be there. Parking is terrible with many walking more than a kilometre along the road to get to the lifts. When you get there, the lines are the worst you will find anywhere in the world, including further up the mountain. No gondolas, no heated or hooded chairs either. A minimal number of runs are groomed. Pick your timing well, as there is rarely sufficient snow. You'll find MUCH better value and conditions almost anywhere else in the world...

name: neil
review_text: Good place for both easy riders and experts and the worst place in terms of resort operation. As I have experience for both Thredbo and Perisher, Thredbo will be the better place for first people who seek the first snow sports experience. Even if you have a good ski level, you may get injured due to the lift operator, and it can be seen easily that they do not take any safety measure when the rider fell off the lift. They focus on better flow, but not safety. The average price is cheaper than Thredbo, so it's only a good place if you are really willing to pay for injuries caused by non-professional staff. Safety and customer service need to be improved. All you need to know is that Vail Resort(Perisher) is the largest resort but not a No.1. Thredbo is Australia's best ski resort.

name: Sean Nairn
review_text:
The largest ski resort in Australia (and I think the southern hemisphere) Perisher has it all. For those skiing here it offers terrain for all standards from beginners to advanced and is most likely to have snow cover at the beginning and end of the season. Plenty of on-snow accommodation or you can stay in Jindabyne and drive up or catch the ski tube.

In terms of things that could be improved, on-snow dining is probably number one. Options are limited and expensive and having more food outlets away from Front Valley would be a help. Otherwise, see you on Towers on Mt P!

name: Josef Pichler
review_text:
We recently embarked on a trip to Perisher to get some skiing/boarding into our legs (5 adults/5 young teens). Despite the fact that we did have lots of fun, pretty good snow & a great experience in general - bottom line is: What one gets for what one pays is not really balanced. The lift equipment is ancient (esp. charilifts without foot rests). Hospitality offerings on the mountain reminded me on the 80s. But especially ticket prices are mind blowing. 2 to 4 times what one would pay in modern proper ski ressorts overseas. 250+ dollars for a day pass is just too much.

Will I come back: maybe

review_text: Just only snow, nothing feel fun , no rides on snow, even no good restaurants, only ski option, no rides for kids on snow bike even bring own skate board for 6-7 years kids, if someone doesn't know ski or skateboard then no fun, only you can see snow only, in India you can have lot of options on snow places, in India there is horse ride , snow scooter rides on rent and lot of more but here only snow skate option nothing else, government needs to provide snow scooter rides on rent or something else for fun,

review_text: We had been to Perisher and we had free play on 18 August 2024. It was snowing while we are there. So much options to spend time on snow with different activities. We have free play around the snow and had enjoyed the moment.

review_text: Loved that place and had so much fun

name: Mia Lawson
review_text: I had a blast enriko deserves a raise he is enthusiastic and loveable at least 10$ minimum

name: Tash Pracy
review_text:
My family and I ski here every year and absolutely love this place. This season, I decided to purchase 5 advanced ski lessons just to tidy up my form and to improve my carving. I booked for the lessons to be at the same time every day and basically had the same people in the class all the way through. However, every day we had a different instructor who asked us what we wanted to focus on, rather than assessing what we need to do to improve. We had to relearn things we'd already gone over and teachers taught vastly different. This made it difficult to improve each day because we'd be focusing on something a little bit different rather than building upon knowledge from the day before. On the Friday they didn't even offer an advanced class and I was stranded in a mixed ability group which didn't necessarily cater to the more advanced skiers.
Most instructors were good, however I had three instructors who wouldn't actually watch anyone ski enough to offer really tailored or personal advice.

Overall, I would still recommend lessons if anyone feels out of control, or even if they want to feel better about their skiing. Basically, everyone will get something out of it. However, it could be far more effective if one instructor was put on a specific level for the whole week.

name: Benjamin T
review_text: Banging good ski location with plenty of runs and good vibes. Friendly staff too!

name: Kevin Cho
review_text: After I experienced ski resorts overseas, now I realise how pathetic Perisher is. Poorly located, no facilities, no 5 star hotels, no alternative places for bad weather day, no staff, poor service, poor terrain, no nice slopes, just no nothing. Pity national park fee. And climate change... and ultra overly priced tickets and accommodation. Just miserable. Visited 2024 season again but nothing's getting better than last year, and they never need it as people will come anyway. Seriously, going overseas resort is a lot cheaper (you bet) and surprisingly better. No more Perisher for the rest of my life, ever.

name: Jaknarin Hanthongchai
review_text:
"I had an incredible time snowboarding at Perisher Mountain! The variety of runs catered to all skill levels, from gentle slopes for beginners to challenging terrain for more advanced riders. The snow conditions were excellent, with fresh powder that made for a thrilling experience.

The lift system was efficient, minimizing wait times and allowing us to maximize our time on the slopes. I also appreciated the friendly staff and well-maintained facilities, including cozy lodges for warming up and grabbing a bite to eat.

The scenery was breathtaking, with stunning views of the surrounding mountains. Overall, Perisher is a fantastic destination for snowboarding, and I can't wait to return for more adventures!"

name: CHUANMING XIA
review_text:
We had the pleasure of having Ben (Benoit Vidotto) as our private full day instructor on 03/08/2024.

We couldn't be more grateful for his exceptional patience and dedication. Despite our group of six having varying levels of experience, Ben ensured that each one of us received personalized attention and instruction. His ability to teach us with such care and perseverance, especially while navigating the challenging slopes, was truly remarkable. Ben's professionalism and expertise have made our skiing experience unforgettable. We wholeheartedly believe he is an outstanding instructor.

review_text:
It's OK for Australia. Need to get there early to beat the traffic and get a parking, avoiding to be turned around to take the overpriced ski tube.
Talking about overpriced, Perisher certainly meets that criteria except for season pass holders who go there very frequently

name: Nelson Judaya
review_text: A perfect ski resort. My 2nd time here.

name: M. X
review_text:
They call this place Perisher because your money just perishes. Bring lots of money with you because you will pay through your teeth for everything. Arranged lessons for my beginner level children and they claim that it is mandatory to pay for lift tickets even though they don't use the chair lifts. I disputed this charge and basically their response was "too bad"!! The cost for two hour lessons with non use of the chair lift was $600. What a scam!! Other scams prices was the price of a hot chocolate $10, a small muffin $12, small hot chips $10.

The Perisher provided trainer for the lessons was called Paddy and he was extremely poor in teaching my kids. He lacked patience and wasn't very clear in explaining the techniques. I could see as I was watching the entire time that other members from the group were getting extremely upset at the trainer.

To conclude I won't be visiting the area ever again as it's just a money making scheme and the snow is gradually getting lesser and lesser each year. The snow report prior to heading to Perisher was "expected snow fall over night with cloud and gusty winds" when we arrived on the day it was clear with no wind and no snow falls which is another lie/scam the Perisher website cons you to visit.

name: wayne royce
review_text: Perisher fix your parking for people that buy day passes and yearly passes this is getting beyond a joke they closed the road because your car park is too full yet you still accept the money from tickets sort this out now . it's been going on to long over selling tickets.

name: John M
review_text: Very frustrating that there is no way of calling the resort by phone. It makes planning a trip there hell as it's all online which can't answer and solve all queries. Lowers the standard of a true resort.

name: Kerryn Ernst
review_text:
Another great week at Corroboree Lodge in Perisher Valley.
Beautiful location and a beautiful family running the lodge with great staff from around the World. Compliments to the chef's for the most delicious dinners!!

name: Jaydeep
review_text: Great snow

name: Ethan
review_text: Cool large resort, bad lift lines often

name: wenlin Leong
review_text: Ski instructors George and Omar were so kind, patient and reassuring to a beginner skier, and they really made my trip to Perisher incredible. 10/10 would go back.

name: Prashanth Paramu
review_text:
Perisher Valley offers a great skiing experience for families and serious snow enthusiasts alike.
The slopes cater well to all skill levels

name: Jeff Sui
review_text: remember parking ticket

name: M.L SLIME
review_text: Big thanks to Eileen and Alastair in the Perisher gear hire for going out of their way to help me with an issue with gear from another hire company. I ended up having the best day of snowboarding I've ever had as a result.

name: Ivan Solomaha
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Family"},{"name":"Rooms","value":5},{"name":"Service","value":5},{"name":"Location","value":5},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Luxury, Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Kid-friendly, High-tech"}]

name: Amon Walker
review_text:
Poorly managed roads !
This is either  the fault of NPWS or Perisher.
I'm sure one will blame the other .
They can spend millions on snow guns but can't organise a safe commute for people driving.
Poorly staffed chainbays!
I was told today they didn't have anyone to check chains had been correctly fitted!
Then witnessed several cars crash off the road because of poorly fitted chains!
If that's not poor management what is ?
NPWS should be removed from attempting to organise the roads!
Or will they wait until someone is killed!

name: SLC2283
review_text:
Big resort, lots of options for all ski levels. But it's extremely busy. Hire gear from somewhere else. Try to get away from the main lifts and explore the less popular areas to get a better ski experience.

Very expensive option.

name: Pasang Tamang
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Friends"},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Great view, Romantic, Kid-friendly"}]

name: Femida V
review_text: Awesome spot to experience snowfall and snow activities.

name: Stuart Mcphie
review_text: Great job by Perisher to get the resort open

name: Sam C
review_text: Great place to experience snow

name: Faisal
review_text:
Awesome ski facilities though it gets a bit crowded during the season. Try to go on weekdays.
We stayed in Jindabyne so cannot comments on the rooms and service at Perisher.

name: Cuong Pham
review_text: Trai nghiem tuyet voi!
review_translated_text: Great experience!

name: Nguyen Ngoc Tan
review_text: OK

name: Douglas Rogers
review_text: Only 4 Stars but THAT was due only to the weather. My Family had a GREAT day even on the light snow cover. Food offered as usual very good.

name: Milano
review_text:
$255 for one day sky pass !! Excuse me!
Is that legal to charge this kind of money ?
Half of tracks are closed
Total rip off

name: Hong Ngov
review_text: Not what I was expected

name: Karl Boin
review_text: One of my most memorable experience probably. I will be back someday

name: Hannes
review_text: Perisher Valley offers a great skiing experience for families and serious snow enthusiasts alike. The slopes cater well to all skill levels, with excellent ski school programs for beginners and challenging runs for advanced skiers and snowboarders. The convenience of onsite snowsport hire makes gearing up easy, and the cafeteria provides decent food options at fair prices. However, be prepared for potentially long queues during peak times, and keep an eye on snow conditions as they can be variable. Despite these minor drawbacks, Perisher Valley remains a top choice for winter sports in Australia, promising unforgettable moments on the slopes.

name: negin sarmadi
review_text:
I had a terrible experience with this resort. I purchased a half-day pass for myself and my partner, but we only got to use it for two hours due to tremendous traffic and police blocking the road. It is ridiculous that I purchased the pass, bought a bus ticket, and left for the resort two hours before my booking start time for what should have been a 30-minute drive using public transport, which should be punctual. Yet, we ended up using only two hours of our expensive pass.
When I reached out to customer service, they were incredibly rude and dismissive, completely ignoring me and ruining my time there. I spent a lot of money getting there and renting gear, but even with all of that, when I saw the crowd and the long lift line with only two hours left, I begged them to transfer my pass to another day. They refused, saying that since I still had two hours left, they couldn't do anything. I am extremely disappointed and would never expect such awful customer service from Perisher. They easily oversell the passes but behave like scammers when it comes to accommodating their users and customers.

name: Edith Chow
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Friends"},{"name":"Service","value":4},{"name":"Location","value":5},{"name":"Nearby activities","value":null},{"name":"Safety","value":null},{"name":"Walkability","value":null},{"name":"Food & drinks","value":null},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Great view, Kid-friendly"},{"name":null,"value":"Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food & drinks"}]

name: Leone Doyle
review_text:
Family of 5. More expensive lift tickets then thredbo. Hugely more expensive for kids lessons which are also shorter duration. Kids have a small lunch whereas thredbo they can eat until they are full. More wind holds than thredbo, wait lines commonly 30 min on holidays. Long drive in - 45 from jindy or more if snowing or chains needed. The tube is faster but so expensive we just couldn't justify it.

Honestly if you're a family I would go to Thredbo or New Zealand. Even if the snow isnt as good we end up skiing more because lines are shorter!

name: Im Imran
review_text: It's ok

name: Daniel McMillan
review_text: Great family resort. Staff are amazing

name: stuart mcphie
review_text: Australia's biggest resort. Best place to ski

name: Sergio Aristizabal
review_text:
Worse place to be with your family.
If you need help you better pray to God because there it's none to help. Disgusting area overcrowded.

name: Wazza Bear
review_text: This place could be so much better. Lack of facilities, amenities and so hard to get to in peak season

name: Jackson S
review_text: LOVE THE SNOW
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Family"},{"name":"Rooms","value":5},{"name":"Service","value":4},{"name":"Location","value":4},{"name":"Rooms","value":null},{"name":"Safety","value":null},{"name":"Food & drinks","value":null},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Great view, Kid-friendly"},{"name":null,"value":"Rooms, Safety, Food & drinks"}]

name: Kiran Sheelavantar
review_text: Best place for families to enjoy snow. Plenty of parking, good amenities and great for the toboggan play area.

name: Campbell Hillman
review_text: Outrageously overpriced.

name: A K
review_text:
Negligent staff, old lifts, too expensive.

Perisher is a lovely resort, especially from the perspective of someone who has skied extensively in the European Alps. However, I am concerned about the safety of younger skiers and snowboarders. The old chairlifts are particularly problematic as they move too fast and lack sufficient personnel to assist, especially at the top.

Recently, my child got stuck while disembarking, causing him to panic and jump from a height of three meters. The lift attendant did not stop or slow down the lift, nor did they assist us promptly. Thankfully, my son wasn't injured even though he had a second blackout, but the incident was frightening.

I urge other parents to closely watch and help their children disembark from the old chairlifts, as there is a noticeable lack of safety measures and staff support!!!

name: Paul Baka
review_text: Rip off lift ticket prices

name: MC Alex
review_text: Seems to be better option than Thredbo for visitors looking for short snow experience.

name: Andrew
review_text: purchased skiing lesson and epic pass, was advised by them to cancel both due to covid on june, but it takes them one week to response the first email, and never got back to me regarding refund after first email, even I waited for nearly 2 months, and fair trading cannot even get contacted with them too, is this resort bankrupted or what? where is  the customer service team????

name: martha castilla
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Couple"},{"name":"Rooms","value":4},{"name":"Service","value":4},{"name":"Location","value":4},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Luxury, Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Great value"}]

name: Stephen LACAZE
review_text: Australian Snow Resort ... that for its short 3 month season has by international standards quite reasonable skiing and boarding. Extensive and well managed terrain provides lots of options.

name: Reuben Stead
review_text: Kinda cold. Bit of snow. Crowded

name: Balint Boda
review_text: Almost always understaffed, crowd coordination is very poor. It's almost like they are surprised to have huge crowds when there's a decent amount of snow in the forecast. Lifts never open on time when there's snow. The social media team always posts about how good conditions are even when they know lifts are 2 hours delayed, and crowds are already forming. Time and time again, Vail resorts fails to organise appropriately or communicate with their customers that pay good money to ski.

name: frances w

review_text: Amazing location & staff what a vibe!
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Friends"},{"name":"Rooms","value":5},{"name":"Service","value":5},{"name":"Location","value":5},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Kid-friendly, Great value"}]

name: Lachlan King
review_text: honestly love it here

name: uyen mai
review_text: Absolutely disgusting and a big scam. I am just a ski beginner and they scamed me. When I bought the lesson for beginner and the lift access, they did not let me know that when you get on the lift and get to the top, you need to ski back to the ground. This is unethical, they just want to make money out of people who have no ideas about skiing. Everyone, please be mindful about the ski service of this resort, especially for beginner. I will never come back and definitely will let my friends, family or other people who I know that will never come here again. Please refund my money back for the lift access

name: Honest Guide
review_text: Nice

name: Gary Lane
review_text: Nice, easy drive from Jindabyne

name: Budy Widjaja
review_text: ski resort yang bagus dan indah... sayangnya kami ke sana hanya sedikit saljunya, bisa dikatakan bukan waktu yang tepat. tetapi walupun begitu ternyata ramai sekali pengunjung yang mencoba bermain ski dan snow board.
review_translated_text: nice and beautiful ski resort... unfortunately we went there with very little snow, you could say it wasn't the right time. But even so, it turns out there are lots of visitors trying to ski and snow board.

name: John Macral
review_text: Very disappointed that the Perisher dashboard was discontinued, it was a great feature. It was great to be able to find your friends on the mountain and see the leaderboard

name: Steve Dunn
review_text: Lots of fishing nearby, which is why I was there.

name: Harry
review_text:
Perisher has got to be some of the slowest, shortest ski runs in Australia. Even though is is very big. It's pretty much same same, short runs, very flat, and extremely crowded.
I have found another income stream for the resort, they could serve lunch in the lift queues, that's how long they are.
Perisher makes bad skiers who can even carve properly when they are put on actual hills. They seem to loose control on extremely steep terrain because they are simply not used it.

name: Leonard Collins
review_text:
absolutely best terrain for families.

take your little ones to smiggins holes to ski and board just down the mountain from the main resort go early july to mid august when there is plenty of snow as this is lower on the mountain and melts first when spring comes.

very gentle slopes for beginners, magic carpets, j bars to get you started and moving slowly until your ready to advance to a T-bar

take lessons if you can stretch your budget and you will enjoy your skiing experience more.

(go ice skating if you have never skied, before you go to the snow  get some experience on a level gradient, skiing down hill is an expert sport not for the faint of heart)

but learning at smiggins is easy and fun.

if you have skiied before and are confident in riding T-bars and chairs head to perisher village 8!

perisher is great for families as it has all the gradient and skill levels catered for.
pretty valley, happy valley and pleasant valley are our families favourites when travelling with the girls and Guthega  for dare devil fun off jumps and scooting tree lines with the boys.

what i love the most is it's an easy to navigate resort  well laid out lifts so you can travel long distances easily and there is always a good spot even when the weather is off. and you can get indoors if needed.

perisher is a very wide mountain resort  lots of runs varying skill levels and well sign posted and it's super safe. the snow is never that deep which is good and bad.

bad if it's not been snowing much it's icy and hurts to fall (get lessons)

good you can find your way around and you won't get into a situation where you fall upside down or can't get up because the snow is so deep.

food is dear at the snow as it has to come a lot further up with difficult access so it's all at a premium and that's fair they have to make 4x profit to make it worth their while for the few months they are open.  don't skimp on food and drinks because of cost, your doing hard physical exercise you need to sleep and eat well to have any fun and go easy or don't even drink alcohol.

my favourite place to eat is the Japanese noodles place!

perisher has good shops to up grade any equipment you have and i found their prices reasonable , surprisingly. which was great when goggles got foggy and stocks were fallen on. and extra clothing at fair prices to keep the girls rugged up warm.

when i used to hire equipment i used rhythm in cooma they have a huge shop and always have good hire equipment that rotates each year it's not old and worn out. plus you can buy your own gloves googles and other warm things to keep everyone purring and happy.

name: Lawrence Nicholson
review_text: Nice day out motorcycle riding to the resort, great views and experience.

name: Zifu Ruan
review_text: Great place to have fun in winter time! If you are staying for more than 5 days during the season, get epic pass is a better option! Really enjoyed our time here!

name: Darryl Alexander
review_text: Present walk and chear lift ride

name: Toni W
review_text: Plan well ahead and book everything in advance for the peak snow season and be prepared for queues no matter what. Once your expectations are set, head out very early, then you'll appreciate all this place has to offer and you might even be lucky with "wait time".

name: Simon Bold
review_text:
No lifts really open. The ones that are, are very crowded, Vail don't invest in Perisher at all while charging $230 for a day pass.

None of the restaurants I've been to accept the epic pass so how can they really advertise it getting discounts if you can't use it?

Almost no detachable lifts. Ski tube is now $80 a day for a train that is 40 years old. Further, I saw a poster online (likely from the early 90s), of a $10 return special. Inflation and maintance costs would not increase by 9x in 30 years. This is price gouging at its finest.

My season pass I paid $1000 for didn't work, so we had to ski down to the bottom and spend an hour sorting it. Further, there was no notification that my existing card would be loaded with my new season pass. Of course you have to pay $5 for a plastic card. In whistler, they're free.

name: Paul Roberts
review_text: We were there in summer so nothing happening. Nothing open. The skiing was bad too.

name: James IU Condren
review_text: Drove through perisher on the way to shalets pass

name: Tejash Patel
review_text: Its nice place for snowy lovers ..i  enjoyed a lot with frnds ..

name: Jithu Jose
review_text: A good place to experience the snow with friends and family, awesome atmosphere.

name: mitch middleton
review_text:
perisher have done me dirty.
Broke my leg last November, and was unable to ski or board this season so my season pass was a complete waste. perisher told me my reason does not qualify for a refund or a pass for next season because they were not notified within 30 days.. pretty disappointing. I was advised from hospital my leg was going to be a 3-6month recovery time, but unfortunately that was not the case. I requested a refund before the season even started and  perisher requested me waste another $50 on getting a medical certificate written up only to still reject my request. As if the x-rays of screws and plates in my leg we're not proof enough.   As a previous staff member of the mountain i am very disappointed and at this point i'm not sure if i ever want to return to this money hungry businesses mountain

name: Sahib Singh Panesar

review_text: Been going to Perisher Ski resort for over 15 years used to be fantastic but we went there this year and they don't accept cash anywhere, no staff everything has to be done online, massive queues for lifts even though we went during the week. Parking is a nightmare so go super early. I'm considering next year going overseas my honest opinion

name: Steve Berry
review_text:
Initially, I left a negative review for Perisher as I was concerned that my wife and I would not get our refund, as we had to cancel our lift passes during COVID.

Although the communication with stakeholders could have been better during this time, Perisher worked diligently to get us our refunds.

It would not have been an easy time for the business.

name: Sandra Hube
review_text:
If you are desperate for going skiing then go there, otherwise don't waster your money.
Once on the slopes the skifields are nice for a skiing area in Australia  but getting there is the hard part.
The parking lot doesn't hold nearly enough cars, but noone really tells you that and then you have to turn around, taking public transport. Valuable time given that this will take you 1.5 hours until you can finally ski on a $220 day pass. Everything is ridiculous expensive. The public ski bus ticket return $21, if you wanna go faster the train up was like over $60.
Everything accomodationwise is also very pricey and value for money not at all ok.
If you plan on doing like a week od skiing, then invest in the plane tickets to New Zealand. Better snow,  better prices.
I wouldn't go back and certainly not recommen it.

name: Greenway Coaching
review_text: Accommodation was great. Skiing was pretty good with decent weather. If the conditions deteriorate due to rain or snow, the ski runs are not marked adequately, and this makes it difficult to ski. Some of the lift operators are extremely rude. Most staff are searching for a please and a thank you, but they let themselves and their team down as they have way too much ego. There's room for improvement here which smells like an opportunity for the right recruiting & training organisation. Hopefully the service and ski runs get better

name: Reece
review_text: The guest service is just arbitrarily poor. We had lessons booked and their terms of service say you can't move the lessons within 48 hours (unless it suits them). But there is clearly plenty of availability for the lessons on the day we booked and the day we asked to move (because of predicted poor weather, not change of mind) and rather than just press a couple of buttons and move the date, they spend the same amount of time sending an email back saying sorry, you've asked something that couldn't even be achieved by a Royal Commission. Overall this is the second time we've been this year and the facilities are poor and dated, their guest services are useless and their policies are just unnecessarily convoluted and negative. The experience has made it likely that I will never return to a ski field in Australia and just go to (unbelievably) cheaper and better run ski fields in other countries. Well done team.

name: Kamsiah Mckeown
review_text: Love it,awesome experience

name: Jiy L
review_text: Firstly, the parking situation is appalling. The car park was full early on so we were asked to park on the side street at the car park entrance. We then carried our 3 year olds and their snow gears all the way to ski school, it is very far. We were late of course and they were banned from joining the class and reasons given were inconsiderate, lies and motivated to just take your money for the day and move on. Coordinating lady in red were rude, spoke down to us and the next day terrorised us and our kids. They've labelled the area for first timers but really aren't able to cater first timers needs and have scarred our children from what could be a positive ski experience. Our kids were asked to leave because the instructors were not able to handle too many struggling kids. A whole lot of other kids were crying but they were not asked to leave because their parents aren't there. The facilities are so dated and the exorbitant food aren't up to standards at all. Extremely disappointing and will not return. We also collectively found staffs were racist, we were spoken to and treated differently. In this day and age in a tourist destination, it is very sad and disappointing to see. In summary it was a complete rip off experience for us.

name: Lucas Zhu
review_text:
We did not stay at the resort overnight, instead visited as day skiers. The resort was crowded during school holidays, as expected for all Australian ski resorts, but the lack of value for money was the major issue.

One aspect that particularly disappointed us was the locker rental. We rented a locker onsite and initially planned to use it for three days. However, upon receiving a recommendation from our coach, we opted to practice at Smiggin Holes due to shorter queues and more beginner-friendly tracks. When I approached the resort officers to request a refund for the remaining days, they directed me to fill out an enquiry form online. After patiently waiting for three days, I finally received a response. To my dismay, they informed me that the lockers were operated by a contractor, and as a result, no refund could be issued. This inconsistency and lack of responsibility on the part of the resort management were truly frustrating.

Overall, the Perisher resort failed to meet our expectations and left us feeling dissatisfied. The high prices, overcrowding, and lack of accountability regarding the locker rental all contributed to my decision to give it a 2-star rating. I would caution others to consider these factors before choosing to visit this resort.

name: Candy
review_text: Good , beuty, nice, verry cool

name: Badri Sukumaran
review_text:
Went for vacation to Perisher, didn't stay there. Reasonable food options until 3PM, transport-
ski tube frequency is okay every 30 minutes but always crowded.
Car drive is great but not on snowy days, check the weather before you start. You need to pay $30 for round trip
Free bus shuttle frequency from Perisher to Smiggins hole is very good
Atmosphere- awesome
Cost - very expensive accommodation but food cost is fine
Ski rentals- Need advance booking

name: Jeremy Sun
review_text:
Drove to Canberra the day before. Took a shuttle at 5am the next day to Bullocks Flat for SkiTube. Got our gear in Bullocks Flat and have to carry them around all day. Should have picked them up at Perisher Valley. Spent 5 hours on the beginner slope. Left at 3pm. Back to Canberra at 7pm.

The day we were there, there was a snow harzard @ -2.2degC. We had to get ourselves skimasks and goggles on top of our 5 layers of clothes and 3 layers of pants.

Should have booked their 2 hrs learning lessons. You'll need lift tickets unless you plan to sit it out. Kids are mandatory to wear a helmet.

Plenty choices for lunch, but it was difficult to get a seat. The place was crowded with people.

Bullocks Flat was snowing on our way back. So glad we didn't drive ourselves.

name: Luke Fitzgerald
review_text: Save your money and go overseas...

name: Isabel R Stephens
review_text: I find that all Perisher 'Lifties' are lovely and friendly but we met a wonderfully helpful Lift Ticket checker at the Perisher Quad Express by the name of Joel who was beyond kind and helpful to my daughter and I when she misplaced her phone. Due to Joel's helpful assurance and kindness, we were able to successfully find my daughter's phone and ensure that the rest of our vacation at Perisher was not ruined. Thank you so much again Joel and we hope to see you again next year!!

So obviously choose profits over customer satisfaction.

name: Kate Knight
review_text: Don't say you will open lifts only to have them on wind hold all day with no intention of running them. Seriously it's the last weekend of school holidays and you couldn't scrape together a few lifties to make the queues bearable. Terrible management

name: Tron Wolf (TronWolfSkullGaming)
review_text: I absolutely loved playing in the snow

name: Alexander Pattison
review_text: Perisher has some good ski runs, but there are too many T-bar ski lifts with too many snowboarders who keep falling off. It impacts the enjoyment of all skiers, this is compounded by very mixed ski quality. In Australia this counts as a good ski resort, but in many cases you can fly to another country and get better skiing for less money.

name: Alecks Stha
review_text: Damn good and cold

name: Drew Ebbstein
review_text:
Great skiing and helpful staff.
Very expensive if you want to ski or buy food. I would recommend packing food if you're not prepared to spend $28 on a chicken wrap or $16 on a hotdog..
Try to buy ski lift passes a week before as they're cheaper and if your skiing for a week or more, maybe look at an annual pass..

name: Silver bullet Pro
review_text: Very good Ski Resort with lots of options to have fun in the snow. Luckily overnight the snow had created a soft layer across the whole ski resort. However my trip was short but we will be back.

Please get your proper clothing from home or before arriving there

Thanks

name: Tony C
review_text: The only nice thing is the snow.  The facilities are old and dirty.  Overcrowded and everything is insanely expensive.

The Customer service rude people told me that no lift ticket no lesson and also they told me that the lesson is held in up mountain by having to catch cable car go up there. This commercial service absolutely misled consumers.

name: Milan Dzavoronok
review_text:
Bought today 2 tickets , they were wrongly dated by customer representatives. Have to go two times to visit reception. Nobody cares just to take money and have bad attitude on the end
Sad to see this

name: Mariusz
review_text: Too expensive, too many people, lifts close in high winds

name: Gunawan Tandun
review_text: The place is nice, but need a lot of effort to reach there

name: Jamie Roberts
review_text:
Had a great day skiing and Playing in the snow
Ski instructorers were amazing
Food was nice but expensive

name: WAN LU
review_text: The private lesson instructor Laura ended private class earlier than the time should be. The private lesson should be end at 4 but Laura ended at 3.43 pm one the first day and 3.40 pm on the second day. Even after the parent communicated with her to end class at 4 pm or at least between 3.45pm - 4 pm she insisted to end the class at 3.40pm. One day of the whole day private lesson cost 1277 AUD and the duration of the class should be from 9am-4pm. Make complainant to the instructor's supervisor, a female supervisor always said she would contact the parent but never did. A male supervisor said he would call back but till we leave the resort he hasn't talked to us about how to solve it.

name: Vivian S
review_text: We went late June for one day at Perisher, and were very fortunate enough to have vivid fresh snow. We parked at Bullocks Flat, took the Skitube and got off at Perisher Valley, hurried over to Perisher Centre to get rental snow jacket and pants, and the skiing boots, helmet and skis. Goggles and neck scarfs are byo or buy in venue and are recommended on very snowy days. Bags and shoes placed in small-ish rental lockers that were roughly the size of a microwave each. We took the 9am beginners lesson and the instructors are very friendly. All this was easily booked and paid online via the perisher website where you'll get a QR code to scan at the ticket machines there and print out a Mountain access card for each person. Like some others have said, Perisher Valley isn't the most beginner friendly, even their Front Valley slope is steep in some areas and need decent steering skills to minimise falling over. Thredbo has a better kid and beginner friendly area close to ground. The queues to the chairlifts are iconically long during the winter peak + school holidays period but they do take you quite high up the mountain so it's worth the thrill gliding down.

name: Neil Geddes
review_text: Snow was awesome we had a great time skiing

name: Rayman Adlgostar
review_text:
Perisher charges a premium for its name and yet is unable to manage their lifts operation effectively to service the skiers. I was there from Thursday last week till Saturday and most lifts were closed. The funny thing was that the triple lift in sniffing a was open and not the tBar, wind on Saturday was strong but wasn't too bad and surely the tBar could be operated. I heard that they were understaffed which makes sense. Whilst they knew is going to be windy they still advertise that they are going to open the lifts but in reality only 2 lifts were open in perisher.
I take my money somewhere else to ski who doesn't

name: Bert Ayanu
review_text: Great place..... must visit destination in the Snowy Mountains

name: Brett Higgins
review_text:
My snowboard was stolen inbetween coming in from a run and picking up my boys from a lesson. The staff were dismissive and downright absent. The worst customer non-experience ever!
The best response was when I asked to cancel the following day lesson, "you need to email your request to cancel the lesson and your reason."

name: Josh Groban
review_text: Dated facilities and crowded! Its time to upgrade and update your facilities. You are charging mega bucks but your services and basic facilities are nowhere near what we are paying. No public free wifi - this is the basic service you should provide! Proper seating with charging facilities. Not everyone who visits Perisher actually going skiing! Parents have nowhere to go when others are skiing away! Food prices are exorbitant! $9 for a bottle of drink? $23.50 for a kebab? Seriously??? Locker facilities have been updated recently and so has the prices! A small locker will set you back $22 per night? Its now cheaper to go skiing overseas like Queenstown and Japan. You will never be able to boost the local tourism with these. Reflection required!

name: Dr Jilani Latona
review_text: Terrible customer service. Provided wrong advice and staff not very helpful- they assume that you know everything about the place not considering that some people are first timers. Charged for lift chair for kids lessons when it was not required ($500 gone to waste).  Everything is overpriced- Best to go somewhere else

name: Jessica Potts
review_text: Really enjoyed perisher it was lovely

name: Alex Zajicek
review_text: Not alot of snow at the start but when it snows its amazing!

name: Joshua Jackett
review_text: Absolute ripoff!! over loaded ski lines, poor overpriced food, rooms that haven't been updated in 40 years. Save your money and head to Japan (in real terms it's probably cheaper and definitely nicer).

name: L E T H A L
Wise Rentals
review_text: Loved this mountain till I spoke 2 minutes with head of pathways Katie Kreczman. She has absolutely no customer service skills and was the most rude individual I have ever encountered in 45 years of skiing and 25 years skiing with vail resorts around the world. Husband worked for them for years and he couldn't believe the way Katie spoke and reacted to a basic query of why kids weren't training on the race flags set up and why kids who are 6 not the correct  the age of the program less than 100 cm tall and can't ski a black run or can't buckle their boots in the program taking up all the coaches time. If you can't  handle a question and falsely advertise a program you shouldn't be working for vail resorts. Hotham and Thredbo are now my favorites in Australia. Don't bother here it's too crowded and the lifts are all on wind hold every five seconds with hour long lines and terrible customer service.

name: Aden
review_text:
I have a lot of love for Perisher and the area.
Unfortunately Vail resorts (Perishers owners) now only prioritize profits $$$

Doesn't matter if the lift lines are 30min long.... Management still didn't do the right thing and open more today. Despite  everything else being in place.
Pure greed!

name: Damodar Joshi
review_text:
Good place for stay.. if you are going to snowy mountain...

Nice food...
Overall good

name: David Green
review_text: Easily the most well organised and laid out ski resort in Australia. Biggest by miles heaps to see and do.

name: Savvy Pandey
review_text:
Awesome place for family vacation.
Lovely atmosthere. Snowy everwhere. Like a fairy tale in childhood time. Yiu must go once in lifetime.

On 22nd of june, Only 10% of the mountain open for boarding yet $189 for a day lift pass. Takes 30 seconds to finish the trail but 5 mins for lift queue. I understand that not enough snow at the this time but why charge such prices. Nowhere in the world is this expensive at this quality.

Toboggoning area is marked as "closed" so kids suppose to have what fun??  In thredbo, no tobogganing either? How can these guys call it "family fun?"

name: Ich Bin Gnade - Michelle Astorga
review_text: Great place for ice sports like skiing, tubugan and boarding. Place is big enough to accommodate a huge crowd.

review_text:
Fantastic. Lots of parking and easy walk to lifts and hire outlets. Limited food options.

Can do snow play to the right of car park which the kids enjoyed.

Gets really busy. Have not stayed here but there is a bus between here and smiggens.

review_text: Well lots of people think that there is no car access to Perisher Valley that you need to get a skitub (train) to mountain but well that's wrong as they have car access so if you looking to go there with car will be easy for you

review_text: Terrible lift management, no single queues and not filling up all chairs despite hordes of people waiting. Very disrespectful towards queueing people having purchased expensive lift passes and want to get value for money and get as much time on the slopes as possible. They should look at how it's managed in places like Norway instead and adopt industry best practices in lift management..

name: Melissa Roberts
review_text: Home sweet home

name: Nolan Wu
B
review_text: Very disappointing to be charged for family lift passes (approx $500) not to be operating other than the magic carpet (100M) which we DID NOT use as it was pointless. We also emailed the day b4 arrival to try and get a refund.

name: Glenn Bassett
review_text: Looks fantastic. Can't wait for the season to commence.

name: Nancy Kung
review_text: Charlotte pass is worth visiting in both winter and summer.

name: Mean Min

review_translated_text: First time coming We just did something easy first, Toboggan  Next time, Ski lessons, the tuition and gondola fees are not cheap at all.

name: Jay Pathade
experience_details: [{"name":"Trip type","value":"Vacation"},{"name":"Travel group","value":"Solo"},{"name":"Hotel highlights","value":"Great view, Quiet, Great value"}]

name: Lloyd Zeng
review_text:
Go here almost every year and it is always great! Has a great variety of runs of varying length and difficulty so there is an option for everyone. Some of my personal favourite runs include; kamikaze (a harder run for older and more experienced skiers) and rollercoaster in Blue Cow, Wood Run (great for kids and new skiers) and Blanchy's in Smiggins Holes, Powder Ridge (probably the easiest black thats ever open) and Goat's Gully in Front Valley Towers run and GS Bowl (should be a black) in Mount Perisher, and Easy Rider (very long but easy) and Mother in Law in Guthega.

Perisher also has great cafes and other restaurants/food places throughout for a great break from skiing with excellent food and drinks, my personal favourite and recommendation is the Pretty Valley Kiosk due to its incredible hot chocolates. If you are in Front Valley during lunch I would also recommend taking a trip to the Perisher Centre as it has a series of restaurants, cafes and shops to buy ski gear if yours breaks.

Even though Perisher Resort is huge, if you are even just an intermediate skier you can pretty easily make it the whole way around the resort and back if you know the way or just follow the signs as they are very helpful.

Not to may complaints just some of the lifts are old and please replace the Pretty Valley Double Chair, it is only about 1km yet it feels like it takes 15min, please speed it up, please.

name: Damien Cutrupi
review_text:
The perisher park is great. The staff situation for the obsene amount of money we paid and the complete lack of parking was killing me. 1 hour long lines on snow days. And un maintained t-bar runs meant that i ended up my a split lip and a missing goggle lense from a mass set of whoops in the middle of the tbar, my daughter hurt her leg, my friend fractured a rib because the under the t-bar was not maintained for 4 days.
And i pay for that very thing. If it happens next this year you can expect to get the bills.

name: Brodie Roberts
review_text:
Lift ticket prices keep going up, but fail to see any improvement of either the carpark, the park facilities, the volume of people, or customer service of Perisher staff.

I'll save my money and head overseas.
You can do an identical trip in NZ for cheaper - $436NZD vs $550AUD ($405NZD)

name: Ben Matthews
review_text: Over 200 bucks a day most of the ski season, average at best for the price

name: patrick rooney
review_text: It's the Best

name: Peter Smith
review_text: Great for families with young kids - a memorable day in the snow. Took the kids there last winter and had a great day out with the toboggans in the designated area without having to pay the chair lift fees. They also had a tube ride, which cost extra, but it was fun. Make sure you get back to the car by the time the sun sets, as it gets icy cold really quickly.

name: Hugh Alston
review_text: Beautiful weather and fresh air

name: Lance Beevers
review_text: It's always  a  great place to visit summer and winter

name: Rowan Cave
review_text: Go overseas, such a rip off, by the time you pay for accom and lift tickets you could have had a decent trip to Europe. Doubled their prices during covid then never reverted back.

name: John Abilas
review_text: Better than Thredbo. Food options decent.

review_text: It's was a very nice stay! Would highly recommend to anyone staying for the snow season! 100% Choose the Merit Perisher Valley! A great team and a great place to soak in the views... It would be incredible once the snow hits
