name: Richard Hughes
review_text:
It is a great place for a family holiday but of course it is expensive especially for a family. A bit crowded on the weekends and holidays so more toilets with fresh air and carparks would help. The Train also gets over crowded and is expensive. But memories forever.
Try to be early and have a big breakfast to keep you going. Staff, lifts , scenery are fantastic. Some healthier food options would be appreciated.
Probably be back again this year so I guess I rate it.

name: TSZ
review_text:
Had to cancel Epic Pass for 2023 due to injury. Contacted them via phone the computer said only contact via email. Then I sent multiple emails with no reply. Very bad service. Not only me having this problem after reading the reviews. One said: Do not honour season pass refunds. A consistent issue, well known by the ACCC and fair trading. They'll take your money in a heart beat, but you'll never hear from them when lodging a refund request (supported by the correct paperwork as dictated by their own T&Cs). No way to contact them aside from email; and as mentioned, good luck getting a response. Appalling CS.'

I Totally agree

name: Howard Webb
review_text: The best resort for our little bit of snow- but unfortunately restricted by the National Parks of NSW.

name: James Z. Ji
review_text: Perisher is huge! endless places to explore. Lots of untouched powder if weather is good (i.e. snowing). If you are completely new to ski, go Tredbo. Perisher is unfriendly for first timer skier. Long and flat tracks are at the back, not at the front valley.

name: Filip Maravic
review_text: Great resort, loads of places to eat and nice long runs. But the car park is a disaster...loads of pot holes. And their food places need a facelift. More needs to be spent on making the ski resort more of a family friendly exciting place. Because at the moment it's lost its excitement that it had years ago..

name: James

review_text: One of the best place to visit with your family and friends especially if you have kids. Our kids had a blast in the snow. We visit it after winter and still has snow. We did a snow ball fight, we make an igloo and a snow man/our version of olaf. It was such a fun experience.

name: Aldo Gionta
review_text: It'd be awesome during season.

review_text: 2/78 Railway Parade, GLENFIELD 2167, GLENFIELD, NSW, 2167, AU

name: Madeline Schutte
review_text: Beautiful mountain with nice snow. There is a nice centre for food and the ski lifts and magic carpet are cool. Very expensive though.

name: Flora Maria
review_text: This rating has limited to me to give only 5 stars where the place deserves even more than this. Wonderful place where you'd experience snowfall by itself.

name: Gioconda Ward
review_text:
Brilliant place to ski with lots of places to stop and have a drink.or a bite to eat. We always ski at the end of the season and it never disappoints. Blue skies and sunshine with lots of different runs to use. Who could ask for more?
On weekends and on school holidays the carpark fills up quickly so don't turn up later than 9 am or you'll be parking on the street and walking.
To make life easier for yourself HIRE A LOCKER for both your boots and skis if you are on the slopes for several days.
It makes a huge difference both before and after you ski.
Apart from that watch out for fellow skiers and have fun!

name: guemont lee
review_text: Never trust the Blue Cow Pony Ride Carpet opening time on the official web site , yesterday we came twice for it catching the ski tube from perisher valley, after knowing it was open on perisher.com.au, but very frustrating, it was closed whole day. Couldn't use the one day lift ticket !! Wish they could refund for it.

name: Pete Madden
review_text: The company now owns most of food outlets, so you are a captive audience. They are charging some outrageous prices.

name: Aaliyah Frost
review_text: Had a wonderful one day ski trip here, the snow was amazing and the lift lines were relatively short, heaps of lifts open and a good variety of slopes. It was super easy and quick to get our lift passes. The biggest downside was the massive price for one day lift passes and it was difficult to get up the mountain in a 2 wheel drive if you don't want to pay for the ski tube. Overall a good experience.

name: Tianzhuo Chen
review_text: Huge, fun, great snow base even in late September. However vertical drop of each run just not enough. Would prefer Thredbo.

name: Whitney Wong
review_text:
Fantastic place, i wasn't expect it be so beautiful. Really worth to visit for tourists.
I will definitely visit again next year.

name: Erin M
review_text: Awesome if you line everything up like the weather, accommodation, finances etc. Well worth the trip.

name: Philip Spiers
review_text: Fantastic place to ski and visit in the summer.

name: Tammy Richie
review_text:
The snow was so incredible considering it's almost the end of the season.. So grateful for the big 60cm dump last weekend..
Was gorgeously sunny first couple days & got cold & misty today that added to the experience..
was very well kept...
All of the chair and T bar were up and running and the queues were short. Some of the runs were a bit icy but not too bad and could be skied right over..
Some of the tracks that are super icy are closed but it won't deter you from having fun & creating memories..
I recommend you leave as early as possible to get a parking spot as it fills pretty quickly & they've now extended the season due to the incredible conditions yay
because it gets insanely packed very quickly...
I'm sure you'll have a blast !
Go get out & explore !
Fun

name: Anton smith
review_text: Great open space fun good staff ! Food is expansive flavour in good.

name: Vandana Chauhan
review_text: BEAUTIFUL  visited on the first week of July this year on a lovely sunny day!

name: null
review_text: snow was surprisingly great for September and was very well kept. All of the chair and T bar were up and running and the queues were short. Some of the runs were a bit icy but not too bad and could be skied right over. I recommend you leave as early as possible to get a parking spot because it gets insanely packed very quickly. I would recommend getting there at around 7:30 which gives you the best chance at getting a good parking. Also giving you the longest amount of time to be able to ski.

name: Ada b
review_text: It would've been five stars if it hadn't been for the nasty comments from Josh about our "mentally slow" fellow learners. on the first day, we had Joe and he was amazing and very encouraging and compassionate. He walked us through the process and understood that snowboarding is challenging. to our surprise, on the second day we had Josh and and he was rude and made snarky comments about our performance. We had never been snowboarding before and were new to the sport and we deserved more respect then what we were given.

name: Frederic Morueta
review_text: La station est super grande. Les pistes sont variees et le paysage est magnifique. Je skie habituellement au Japon et a Queenstown en NZ, et bien la c'est bien mieux que Queenstown sans hesiter.
review_translated_text: The station is super big. The trails are varied and the landscape is magnificent. I usually ski in Japan and Queenstown in NZ, and this is much better than Queenstown without hesitation.

name: Victor Palekas
review_text: Prices through the roof! Slopes are made of snow, not gold. If it was in Dubai, would understand...

name: karken wong
review_text: Lovely skiing spot

name: Matthew Kilgore
review_text: Really fun vibes good crowd plenty of tequila and mezcal and good food.

name: Shoyam Bir Shrestha
review_text: Had my first snowboarding experience here, very friendly people around. You can get accommodations, lessons and gears for hire easily in the area, also there's categorised areas for beginners and intermediate for skiing/snowboarding. Check Perisher app for more info

name: Christine Hornig
review_text: Very expensive with less service as in previous years.

name: Bassam Almazyad
review_text: Fun but not cheap

name: Jonathan West
review_text: WOW

name: Karina Leigh
review_text: I hadn't been to the snow in 6 years and cannot believe the price of a lift ticket. Especially considering the crowds there. Some lift queues took 40 minutes. Everything else, I would have given 5 stars but the lift ticket and overcrowding needs to be immediately addressed. It was so hard to  spend almost $200 a day on the ticket alone. I love skiing but I don't think it's worth it for that price. I'll find somewhere more reasonable.

name: esther see
review_text: Nothing here for a non skiier. Spent 3 days waiting in the car.  Skiing was good but its either ski or dont come

name: Tom G
review_text: Best place ever

name: Malek A
review_text:
It was me and my wife's first time at perisher. We started with hiring the equipment that we needed. The two girls that were their were very helpful and helped us choose the right gear and the right sizes all with a smile on their face. We then went on to skiing and we struggled bad lol and unfortunately there were no lessons left and it was our first time skiing. The girls after seeing our struggle came out of their way and sacrificed their lunch break to teach some key skills and what a difference that made. They even took us up the skii lift and down the mountain while helping us the whole way. We actually started to enjoy skiing.

Talija and Zahli thank you very very much. Words cannot describe how thankful we are. Your smiles and sacrifice meant so much to us and it made our experience unforgettable.

name: sameer saleem
review_text: Loved it

name: Bhushan Raut
review_text: Nice place to experience snow with family

name: Shreyas Muralidharan
review_text: The NSW skiing haven! The place is an absolute beauty and can get very crowded but was fabulous. Lot of skiing options for all ages and the accessibility can be a bit of a problem from the city centre but with proper planning one can have a great time here. (Tip: hire all ur equipment at the valley city centre and take it by car so plan ahead of time)

name: Gracey Grace
review_text: Second best ski resort in Australia, after Thredbo

name: Le Duong Duy Lam
review_text: Plenty of food options, good place for kid to roam around

name: Tracey Kisiel
review_text:
In all the years of visiting Perisher we caught a rainbow this morning on a busy spring Saturday morning. Carpark was full by 8:15am and parking along the side of the road went further than you could see.
The team at Perisher are always friendly and lots of snow still on the mountain 39/45 lifts still operating in spring. Doesn't matter how many days you do, Still not ready to go home home.

Love Perisher!

name: Ryan Langham
review_text: Incredible place, even better when its snowboard in snowboard out facility!

name: Dean Coleman
review_text: Quite a different season 2022. I think overall they managed reasonably well with a lot of the challenges. One grumble is that the food at all of the resort owned restaurants is significantly more expensive than it used to be whilst the quality has dropped extremely. When dining on mountain you accept that it's going to cost more most of the food on offer is absolute garbage.

name: Robin Schmelzkoph
review_text: The premiet ski fields in Oz.47 lifts over Perisher Smiggin Holes Blue Cow & Guthega ! Love it !

name: Subiran Manandhar
review_text: It was a great experience. But, because, it was our first time, we hardly used the ski pass. I would advise not getting the ski pass if it is the first time.

name: Abi
review_text: The girls and one guy at the guest services desk were so lovely.. They were super helpful and quick to answer my dumb question

name: Romer Balon
review_text: First time to go to this place. We parked at the roadside, very far from the site coz the parking spaces were already full. But there are buses that will take passengers to the site for FREE. These buses will also take passengers back to the roadside parking for FREE. So nothing to worry if u arrive late to enjoy the day at the site.

name: s hadi
review_text: Best place to go if you like a toboggan, a nice cafe, or a good hang-out place, but don't expect comfy foods, super friendly staff

name: Asam Pedas
review_text:
Perisher is nothing like Falls Creek, Hotham or Buller. Our first time this side of the mountain, its flat, its sunny with blue skies .
And the cafes are good

name: Zoe Downing
review_text: The most overpriced resort in the world.

review_text: Great for a couple of days skiing. Lift passes are extortionate.

name: Stephanie
review_text: Had such a fabulous experience at Perisher it was my first time going there to ski and snowboard.

name: Christine Romero
review_text:
Perisher has gone down hill with customer service and the knowledge of their staff. They have changed all the seating at the perisher centre making it hard for kids to sit and eat their food.

And now thanks to Gerry Harvey and Covid everything on Hill is so expensive with a bottle of water costing $5.35 even with the epic discount.

It is what it is, if you want to ski and board in Australia then this is what you have to put up with now. Don't expect a cheap holiday just enjoy what we have, their pass is reasonably priced so there is that going for it so weigh it all up.

name: Leapai sonny Tuiletufuga
review_text: Amazing place.

name: Chris Nothing
review_text: Snow is awesome here. Prices are extortionate. The place is definitely gauging even more than usual. But without choice people will keep showing up here and paying the premiums. Definitely better and cheaper to go to Japan or NZ.

name: Shreyas Mahadevappa
review_text:
Understaffed, Overpriced and overcrowded!

Parking lot gets full by 7:30 am during weekends.

name: Jackson Thomas Mclean
review_text: They don't miss you for anything hey, felt like I got bent over for cash. Never been to the snow probably won't go again. We stopped roadside with hired toboggans and that was more of a ball

name: I don't care
review_text:
Nice view and fun
But everything pricey

name: nck
review_text: Do not honour season pass refunds. A consistent issue, well known by the ACCC and fair trading. They'll take your money in a heart beat, but you'll never hear from them when lodging a refund request (supported by the correct paperwork as dictated by their own T&Cs). No way to contact them aside from email; and as mentioned, good luck getting a response. Appalling CS.

name: Ritonga Ritonga
review_text: Having a lot of fun here.

name: Jade Blacksell
review_text:
This place is a money hungry joke, all the staff were so incredibly rude, in guest services and on the lifts.
We had a family emergency and we are not able to ride the following day and as we pre purchased our tickets, we were declined our refund by the manager, we did email the day before (24 hours) before the slopes opened the next day.
In the terms in conditions it does not state that cancellations must be made at 12am today for our tickets for tomorrow. We have snow boarded around the world and have never experienced this kind of poor service and to think this is in our own country is very upsetting, will not be returning. If you are thinking of coming this way for the snow, definitely visit Thredbo over this ridiculously overpriced and money hungry place.

name: Kevin Loughrey
review_text: Fantastic snow. Quick lifts. Great instruction. Friendly staff. Only negative was that it was a bit expensive but to me it was worth it. I'm totally recharged!!

name: Rek ka
review_text: Spent the day boarding had a great time definitely recommended, car park can be busy but the mountain is pretty good once everyone has spread out over different ski runs.

name: Donna Amaraddio
review_text: Snow was perfect,  friendly staff.  Will be back in August again

name: MikeMike "Billy Blowovanov" Sierra

name: hla moe

name: Tyler Adam
review_text:
Yes, it was fun, but not really worth the cost any more.
Always beautiful, but getting increasingly hard to look past paying over $200 a day to ski Australian snow and having to park about a kilometre and a half away and walk up due to lack of parking by 7 in the morning. The park closures almost every day are completely justified (as there is no room for anyone) but ridiculous for paying customers as it seems like there is no viable solution on the horizon despite releasing the 40 year management plan and by 7am you physically cannot drive beyond Jindabyne due to grid lock. Will be interesting to see what happens before the biggest resort in Australia gets driven into the ground.

review_text: What an amazing place we so enjoyed being back on the mountain. The team at the Eiger did a fantastic job of making our holiday so special

name: Lars Steele
review_text:
Great place, given Australian options, but:
- It feels like the majority of staff are very unhappy - apparently let down by management.
- Personally experienced some lifts and T-bars were stopping intermittently due to (quote) 'poor maintenance'. And lastly;
- They are incredibly misleading with their forecasts (chairs expected open, and on-mountain parking as just two examples). I feel for the families forking out thousands to spend 2+hours crawling up the mountain in a queue of cars 14+km long, only to find the parking is full, and their options are fork out another large amount for SkiTube, or just not go.

Again many positives but Perisher desperately needs to pick up their act to improve these items and more. But hey, they've got a captured market so I'm not holding my breath unfortunately.

Perisher + ski tube:
$222 lift ticket
$87 ski tube
$309 total.

Perisher + drive:
$222 lift ticket
$29 national park pass per car

vs

Thredbo + drive
$189 lift ticket
$29 national park pass per car
$218

If you are looking for a place for snow play and tobogganing in Mt. Kosciuszko national park this is a good option. If you are not confident abt driving in the snow under badv weather conditions, you hv the option to get there by the ski tube from bullock flats.

review_text: Snow. Sliding. Get away from the centre & it's everything one's soul needs....

name: m.manikandan sairam
review_text: Family friendly, kids enjoyed doing tobogganing and making snow man. It was nice to grab a bite, hit food in the cold weather. They do have good vegetarian options

review_text: Great experience

name: rakesh mate
review_text: Nice place

name: William Cawrse
review_text: Pretty cool

name: ramya krishna
review_text: Had a great time. Dont forget to take extra layers for kids like baklava.  My son enjoyed a lot .

name: Sally Fong
review_text: Perisher is our go to place each year we come to the snows. Partly because you can go tobogganing with the family. Parking can be annoying like every other parking. The main building has a number of cafes which are generally over priced. Would be good to see something decent. There's usually a coffee shop, pie shop and a main one. A bottle of water was around $8.... a hot chocolate wad $7.50. I think the general population would be happy to pay for more reasonable prices.

name: Liz Cousins
review_text:
Snow as far as the eye could see
My granddaughter was in frosty heaven 
And the snow just kept falling all day long

name: Linda Tran
review_text: Absolutely wonderful experience as a beginner at Perisher! We booked a beginners class and it was 10/10 worth it. We had 2 wonderful instructors, Andy Aitken and Daisy to the 6 of us and they were absolutely so professional and friendly with their teaching approach. They are clearly experts in their field as I was able to spend the remainder of the days at the snow zipping around thanks to them! All the other staff we encountered on the mountain were also so friendly too. 10/10 will visit again and highly recommend getting lessons!

name: Paul Knapp
review_text:
Everything that's wrong with the Australian tourism industry in one place. The place itself is beautiful but ruined by greedy, low service operators.There's no attempt to even pretend anymore that they're not seeking rent by price gouging for access to a priceless national resource.

For example:
- Extremely high prices by global standards.
- All infrastructure and equipment is old and of the cheapest possible quality.
- Simple things like ski racks on the Ski Tube or shelter near the car park are missing.
- Basic services like looking after your shoes after hiring skis and boots not available. "We don't do that". I had to carry my shoes in my backpack or walk a long way back to my car.
- Won't store ski hire overnight. "You have to take them with you mate."
- Don't build capacity to match customer numbers. It's normal to find nowhere to sit at lunchtime.
- Force you to walk all over the place in ski boots. Ski Tube is a couple of hundred metres from the lifts and up and down stairs. Better to save money on a bit of extra track and make your customers walk than take them where they're actually trying to go.
- Basic things like signs are missing. Had to walk around asking people in shops to find the kids ski school.
- Accommodation prices that would get you a 5 star resort elsewhere will get you the equivalent of a dirty hostel here.

Australia needs to wake up that it's not 1980 anymore and visitors expect reasonable prices and good service.

name: RyedWithMe AU
review_text: Really great place to visit during winter season and stay for a few days. Lots of activities to do like skiing and snowboarding for beginners to intermediate. Theres a place for kids and children to enjoy toboggan and play snowman. Make sure to come early coz parking gets full. Few food stores you can order inside the centre aswell and some souvenirs.

name: Gregory Jensen
review_text:
Huge ski resort with many and various runs. There is a place for most skiers here and many social media advice pages so I dont need to add to it here except for the following.
A) this place is popular and busy, don't come here to relax.
B) prices are not outrageous but a day of takeaway food costs a lot.
C) skiing early is often icy. The best snow is later in the day.
D) it is very easy to loose friends and family here, bring phones.

name: Roger
review_text: Amazing Ski Resort, recommended to get skitube so you can avoid the traffic!

name: Damien Freeman
review_text: I love Perisher, but, if I am picky, I wound make the following suggestions: a) a T-bar from Blue Cow Terminal to enable return to Perisher when the lifts are closed due to wind to avoid having to queue for the Skitube and b) some rope-pulls across Perisher Creek to assist getting between Perisher and Smiggins...

name: Jazz "J_mack86" H
review_text: Although the winter prices are super heavy possibly even a Lil criminal considering the staff are the only  update  this place has had in the last 15-20 yrs I've been visiting .. its still one of my favourite places to ride & visit on this planet .. gumtrees beer & snow ! My type of happy place !

name: Tania Cook
review_text: Beautiful

review_text: Staff are disorganised, no phone support

name: ARUP RATAN Basu
review_text: Nice place. Enjoyed every moment of staying specially during the snowing time. Enjoyed Tobagoning. It was snow everywhere. Lovely. Lot of tourists were there and enjoyed.

name: Awesomeguy900
review_text: amazing snow, rlly fun hills and everything, rlly expensive for the snow tube tho

name: Claudia
review_text:
Came for a feed with friends.  Food wasn't bad but not many food options either.  It was pretty pricy,  and most items averaged at $25+ (not including drinks) but apparently a standard price for perisher.

I ordered the beef lasagna with chips.  You get to choose chips or mash and add vegetables too.
The chips were a good serving size and really nice and crispy.  You could fill up on chicken salt and condiments to your liking on the self serve desk.

The beef lasagna was not bad.  It was a bit mushy in the centre,  however it was a good size and they had a good chunk of cheese on top of the lasagna; just the way I like it.

I ate around 1:30pm and the line was still pretty long,  however not a long wait as they do serve you pretty quickly.  Staff were nice and friendly too.

name: Prakash Patel
review_text: Good one.

name: Soheb Patanwala
review_text: Amazingly beautiful place.

name: Rhys
review_text:
Mixed feelings about Perisher. It has some great slopes and the sheer size of the ski fields is enormous. The staff are super friendly and it seems like a big family of like minded people.

The facilities feel like they are struggling to keep pace with the millions of dollars spent up on the mountain every year. The inflexible way access to the mountain and the chair lifts operates make it hard to justify forking out a small fortune when it feels like a gamble on the weather. Sometimes you win and get consecutive days of great weather but sometimes you don't and just bleed money for nothing in return.

It would be convenient to blame Covid but in reality these things were problems before Covid and nothing has really changed.

A few things that should be on the radar:
- Old and tired locker space needs improving and modernising. Make better use of the space and update the low security padlock/keys to something more 21st Century.
- Some flexibility in lift access passes  such as 3 or 4 days in a week, rather than  enforced consecutive days. Allows you to have a rest day if you like, or take a day off when the weather is poor.
- Same as the previous point with the NSW National Parks access.
- Car parking at Perisher could be vastly improved. The car park is woefully inadequate on busy days. Expanded facilities at Smiggins wouldn't hurt either.

Not expecting miracles. Snow sports will continue to be an expensive option in Australia. I am fortunate to be able to enjoy it.

name: Heath Minett
review_text: Lines are long runs short lift tickets are expensive. But it is Australia so what do you expect

review_text: Cool

The worst customer service. My friend was enquiring about lift cancellation policy (ENQUIRING) and they responded to them that they had cancelled their lifts tickets (?!??) - didn't ask them if they wanted to do it. They then refused to reverse the cancellation and my friend basically needed to pay a higher fee on the same lift tickets.

Appalling.

The snow under the trees were still soft enough to build a snowman and the hills around Perisher were ideal for toboggans - especially with all the hardened snow. Parking was a challenge but there was plenty of on street parking.

name: Max May
review_text: Perisher was alright. It was definitely a great ski resort, with a large variety of ski runs, and many open ski lifts. It had many restaurants and places to eat, however it was extremely crowded. Queues for lifts were much longer than queues I was used to, and the restaurants were extremely crowded. However, Blue Cow and Guthega weren't as crowded as Perisher Valley, so I definitely recommend checking it out there.

name: Anshul Agarwal
review_text: Amazing place with great staff to help you out whilst you ski

name: Justin lEE
review_text: Over crowded. Not enough car parks.

name: hambish
review_text: Wonderful Resort. Contains runs available for multiple types of riders. Blue cow is Great if you want a slightly quieter slope, which generally has better "snow quality" and more "powder". The learning slope there is great, and Lessons happen there too, which I recommend more then Front Valley. Speaking about that, Front Valley is Perisher's main advertised ski learning area, which is not a great area to start off at. The slope is always busy, and too steep to learn on. Great places here to ski with your family (Smiggins Holes, Happy Valley). Just if you're planning on driving up to Perisher anytime after 8am on the weekend, forget it. Just take the skitube, much easier but it can be busy.

name: Danny L'Estrange
review_text: Went there during a blizzard. It was beautiful but definitely not a good day for skiing.

name: Pohar Dutta
review_text: Absolutely stunning...

name: Josh Zzz
review_text: it was funny but I am a beginner, hope to go there again.

name: Johnson
review_text: Good resort, just crowded at times and overpriced

name: Heath Gardner
review_text: Had such an amazing experience at Perisher, It was my first time ever seeing snow and snowboarding. The staff there were super kind and helpful and the ski hills were well maintained. My main problems were that everything was quite pricey along with the ski hill being extremely busy. Unless you were willing to pay for a lesson the steep slopes were kinda difficult to learn on, Sort of a being thrown into the deep end kind of situation. As for the small area provided for learning it was just far too small for the sheer amount of people in there, any attempt to ski down it would almost certainly end in you taking out a family or two. All and all tho it was such a mystical experience to be able to see snow and learn how to snowboard on it.

name: Weihua Tu
review_text: Trust will be better experience when not busy.

name: Melissa Lee
review_text: Fun experience mostly great people

name: EWERTON SCACCIO
review_text: Lugar incrivel com boas vista e varias montanhas para vc esquiar e fazer snowboard...lugar paradisiaco com belas paisagens, com certeza vou voltar mais vezes!!!
review_translated_text: Incredible place with good views and several mountains for you to ski and snowboard...paradisiacal place with beautiful landscapes, I will definitely come back again!!!

name: Yudi Lukman
review_text: The place itself was ok but the variety of food was limited. The snow mostly icy except on certain occasion then it would be nice. The ski lesson teacher was not very cared. The person that guard the ski lift also not very good. Weird thing was the same thing also in Mt. Buller, Victoria. I'd suggest to go to Niseko, Japan, for good ski experience instead.

name: Uzi Panti
review_text:
Wide open spaces, multiple zones to do your desired sport in the snow. But be mindful, food for some reason is 4x more expensive than anything down below, come early or lose parking and you'd have to ride the train up the mountain which cost the same amount of petrol you used from sydney to perisher. What is great is that everything amazing is made by nature, snow, scenery, location... The rest is average to mediocre, like food, toilets, transportation, parking, accommodation, etc etc... All for profit. Still a 4/5 due to the experience.

P.s to whoever is stopping traffic at the intersection of the base of the train station, if they can move further up the road and block traffic that are going straight rather than block even traffic going to the station as it took us and the rest of going to the station 30+mins just to stop for no reason as we were going a different way.

name: Hu Yin
review_text: good place

name: Alice C
review_text: Just great

name: Bora Kender
review_text: Our family has been coming to this resort for many years. The 2022 season has been so poor in terms of resort services and quality of lessons and customer service. We've all been through Covid but when you pay full rate post-covid for amenities and services and they are well below, acceptable levels, the holiday you have been saving up for becomes disappointing. Perisher needs to lift their game

name: Rayson Wiggill
review_text: If you want to try Skiing in Australia, Perisher has all the facilities you could need and loads of passionate instructors. Perisher also has runs across the range so if the win is bad from one side of the mountain the other runs will usually be open so use the train and have fun.

name: Dylan Aston
review_text: Great fun place

name: Mu Jia Zi
review_text: Chao Bang
review_translated_text: Excellent

name: Ajay Mall
review_text: Must go place with all facilities...

name: Sagar Sitaula
review_text: Best place to enjoy snow...@

name: Nickie Chan Tour
review_text: Nice place to visit

name: Shane Kelly
review_text: Love our time in the snow

name: Dominic Wilkinson
review_text: Good for the novice

name: Tim Hoffman
review_text: Over crowed with poor signage and explanation of areas for new visitors. Very expensive place to holiday with ridiculous lines for food options that are also poor quality junk food.

name: Dalibor Stojcic
review_text: Excellent place

name: Hamish
review_text: Open up the t bars. I ain't paying to walk up slopes

name: Alfredo Revelant
review_text: awesome place. Easy access and well organised

name: Michelle Gillard
review_text: The ski school booking and management system is very rigid an inflexible. There is no system for easily confirming what classes have been booked and when your upcoming classes are scheduled. It is difficult to make any adjustments or changes. It also not possible to make a future booking with a specific instructor. The only option is to make a request online, however there is no confirmation or guarantee of who you will get, and no refund if your preferred instructor is not available. Improvements could be made in this area. Other than that we enjoy the resort.

name: Muhammad Ali (Ali Majeed)
review_text: Very crowded though!

name: Paul Johnson
review_text: We were lucky as it was snowing. Ski tube easy if you do not have wheel chains.

name: Donald Chalmers
review_text: Very expensive as it always is but the people are very friendly and the skiing was good.

name: ahlad deshpande
review_text: Good but very crowded

name: Ani
review_text:
Amazing First time snow experience felt withHeart warming snowful   memories .will visit again 
Lessons learned during Visit
1. No Pets allowed in region
2. No car rental available
3.Uber wasn't available with cars at time visited
4. Info centre was super helpful and friendly

name: Paul Luciani
review_text: Since my early days I have been coming here. It only keeps getting better and better as the years go on

name: Malcolm Baker
review_text:
1st timer
Great place to learn
Everyone in good spirits added to a great ambience.

name: Lynne Burke
review_text: great summer location ..nice easy walks from here to porcupine rocks

name: sai nikhil Goli
review_text: Beautiful place

name: Matt Batterham
review_text: Great skiing and heaps of lifts just really expensive day tickets.

name: Ashish Pathak
review_text: Great place for skiing and tobogganing.

name: Ryan Nolan
review_text: So many runs over 4 different mountains. Travelling between them is okay and the facilities are great.

name: Dhavalkumar Patel
review_text: Beautiful place for family holidays.

name: Ben Floro
review_text: Great season so far.

name: Robert Squires
review_text: Biggest rip off ever. You are actually driving patrons offshore with your price gouging.It's cheaper to ski overseas then locally.  If you had half an idea you would be visiting locals accomodation venues and offering them package deals to fill rooms and get more patrons on snow. Your lift pass prices are an absolute joke.

name: Dominik Janusz
review_text: Great choice of activities here including tobogganing. Good free parking.

name: Georgina Smith
review_text: I was overawed by the snow capped mountains.  It was equally inspiring to see thousands of adults , children and skiers enjoying their time in the snow.  They were rolling, tobaggoing, skiing cable carrying, and generally busy making snowmen each doing their own fun thing.The journey by road was exhilarating and loved every minute of my time.

name: Dostum
review_text:
Very famous Snow skiing place of Australia. We hire our equipment from Coom on our way to come here because it is much cheaper. High season better not waste your time to search place to stay here as it is super expensive. We choosed a day trip and still have plenty of time to play. There is also place for young families to play Tobago and it is fun!
Parking is a bit issue so better come here early otherwise you won't find a place to park. I think it is about 30/car for entrance fee at the gate of national park.
We brought a portable gas cooker so we can heat our food and made a simple cup of hot coffee.it was delicious!

name: Neil Pickford
review_text: Well groomed snow on front mountain, delay in road access and distant parking, need to get there really early.

name: Aron Nair
review_text: Awesome place to be.Dress appropriately as it snows anytime during the season.

name: Steven Garland
review_text: Absolutely top place. Great snow. Sick liftys. Yewwww

name: Michael M
review_text:
Heaps of snow, staff are friendly .
Great weather this week

name: Mitch Australia
review_text:
Absolutely fantastic! Always have a great time when I am down in this area. So far this 2022 season I have managed complete 400 lift rides.
Let's see what else this season can bring!

name: Benni Tedja
review_text: In my opinion this ski resort is more beautiful and better than Thredbo.. i recommend this place during winter season

name: Ralph Waddington
review_text: As great as ever.

name: Drew Wadd
review_text: Busy, but lots of fun.

name: Shahed Anwar
review_text: Good but parking facilities need improvement

name: Odisho Yaqow
review_text: I liked it but I didn't stay in the resort because it was fully booked, but other than that it was really good.

name: Jasper Lu
review_text: Better than thredbo

name: Kris Cris
review_text: Always a great skiing experience!

name: Dipti Sharma
review_text: It was amazing and a breathtaking view which was difficult to capture in camera

name: Raymund
review_text: You need be there early or else you wont get a good parking spot. Kids friendly. Good place for tobogganing with the kids. You can also come and relax, buy a coffee or a hot chocolate to enjoy the day.

name: Dianne Smith
review_text: Very good .But don't cater for seniors. If you wanted to go and watch grandkids. To many stairs and no lifts.

name: ivana grace Guerrero
review_text: My first snow experience! Its fun and the place is big. There is a lot of place to take pictures and play with the snow

name: Eimear
review_text: Outrageously overcrowded. Surely they could control the numbers. Pure greed!

name: Will Os
review_text: Rip off just because they can

name: Uma Shrestha
review_text: Kids Friendly best place for Ski, plan ahead. Skitube is very expensive.

name: Mike B
review_text: Today the family had a group lesson at Perisher.  We had mixed abilities on the snow as well as a large gap in ages.  I was a tad concerned how it would go.  Do yourself a favour if you get lessons and seek out Dory.  Young energetic bloke, entertaining as well as a great teacher. Without sounding condescending, a very impressive young man.

name: Cris
review_text: What more is there to say about Australia's biggest ski resort? It has something for everyone. The staff are super friendly and it's always refreshing to have a laugh with the lifties on a cold snowy day. The terrain varies so greatly that there are trails for all levels. One of the special things about Perisher is that you can access most parts of the mountain with an access trail. A big favourite is the traverse from Mt Perisher right over to Guthega.

name: Juan Janse Van Rensburg
review_text: Stunning

name: Vinoj Perera
review_text: Had an amazing week at perisher resort. Undoubtedly Australia's largest ski resort. Don't forget the night skiing on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

name: Ravi Saksena
review_text: Nice place to experience snow in Australia.

name: Kaleb Lawson
review_text: Omg stunning place must go

name: John Dimara
review_text: It was very enjoyable for kids to have fun with the snow. The only thing expensive and ripp off is the food.  I would suggest people to had down to Jindabyne or bring your own food.

name: Joel Amin
review_text: Snow

name: marky mark
review_text: Great fun! So easy just taking the ski tube

name: Raspreet Singh
review_text: Paradise... a beautiful place for holiday.. take your loved ones along and enjoy the nature at ots best. If fortunate enough, snowfall can add to the amazing experience.

name: Michael X
review_text: Well organised lifts and t bars. Be good if the trails were more marked.

name: Matt Doumbos
review_text: Awesome place to take the family, great snow but very pricey, make sure you plan accommodation months in advance, as places book out fast, overall, Perisher is a wonderful mountain, has terrain for all abilities, and the staff on the mountain are amazing, super friendly and will have all the answers to your questions, Perisher is definitely a must do for any snow lover.

name: Emma Gomba
review_text: Perisher is so beautiful, we booked a lesson including the ski lift and it cost a lot of money included 3kids thinking that will be able to snowboard but 3 of our ski lift never been used we ask if we can refund even the remaining days in the card they said no, so just a waste be careful buying online because when your there you don't know what will happen.

name: ashok kumar
review_text: It's snowing now , definitely will enjoy it

name: Sen Sen
review_text:
Come here after 2 years resort close due to Covid19
Snow falls heavily during these days
Need to pay $29/private car
Rent your snow equipment and ready to go

name: Rob Puljic
review_text: Amazing

name: Fabio Eduardo
review_text: What a experience! Definitely a paradise

name: Brian Windsor
review_text: Love the snow

name: Meher Ayyagari
review_text: Good resort to enjoy snow

name: Charlie Simon
review_text: Best ski resort in Australia by far!! Plenty of awesome places to eat and drink and plenty of options when it comes to the slopes

name: RENREN
review_text: Perisher is the largest ski resort in Australia. We should be lucky to be able to ski in Australia!

name: Rashmi Rayancha
review_text: It's was awesome I like it so much

name: Nathan Tanner
review_text: Perisher was stunning. I have spent only a few holidays in alpine areas and had never ski'd before. I was unable to get a lesson because they were booked out, but I hired ski's and had a go at the bottom. Ended up getting an afternoon lift pass for $185 and spent the second half of the day riding the lifts and skiing the slopes. It's an experience I'll never forget. I hope to get back to Perisher one day!

name: Rebecca Buchanan
review_text: Wow, what a place. Perfect for the family or as a single Pringle wanting to mingle. The staff are amazing, the atmosphere is perfect. The snow was a blast. Will definitley be back.

name: Soma Rajesh
review_text:
The place was one kind of experience.
Luckily it wasn't that cold when I was here.
Was enjoying both the weathers at the same time.
Sun and snow..
Becareful while sking.
Don't forget to book for sking classes if you don't know how to ski...

name: Emily Ringland
review_text:
Why can't the ski school price include lift ticket? I was pulled out of the line twice to organise my sons lift ticket halfway through his lesson. Service desk useless both times, couldn't fix the problem. Cost me 30minutes each time I had to go and line up to fix the problem with his lesson.  Time is money on the mountain.
Never paid for lift ticket for the first 3 days of lessons, then get caught out on day 4. This doesn't even take into account the wasted 30minutes at the start of ski school because they have no idea how to organise a bunch of kids eager for ski school. Go check out how other resorts do it Perisher and implement some positive changes. The most disorganised mountain resort I've been to. Happy to take the most money for anything and everything but can't return with decent service.

name: Lili Zhang
review_text: Visited today after many years and felt a bit overwhelmed by the experience. Didn't do much homework so I was a bit lost. Not understanding why we had to buy the lift tickets first before ski hire.

name: Jake Kearns
review_text: Lots of snow, being g mid week lines where short.. good times had by all!.

name: jason dowsett
review_text: Met a great guy named Harrison, he helped me and my family with snow boarding tips and directions. He was fun to be around and was always happy to help. Thanks.

name: DON OSY
review_text: Always an awesome experience

name: soniviel wijaya
review_text: Need more seats and toilets at the food court area. The snow area ok

name: Matthew Cubis
review_text: Awesome time last week on slopes. Straight into lifts. Half day skiing for multiple days sooo much fun.

name: Matt G
review_text: Excellent service and staff is extremely helpful. Especially to the lessons instructors and the staff work in the locker room, you guys are awesome!

name: Natalie Chinner
review_text: Amazing location, like the set up. Shops were decent prices considering the location. Ski lifts good. Good amount of runs, easy to get around. Have mulled wine, winning!!!!

name: Sights and Sounds of Australia
review_text: Perisher Ski Resort is one of the finest Skiing facilities in Australia. There are ample snow gear hiring options within and around it. There is hot food served within Perisher Ski Resort for a nominal price. Toilet facilities are also available which are frequently maintained and are relatively clean. We were traveling with three kids which included a one year old however the trip went smoothly. Don't forget to arrive early to get a parking spot bearby the resort otherwise, you have to catch a free bus to get there.

name: Rin Banks
review_text: Premium price of $200 a day at the start of the season and there's brown patches all over the piste, half the lifts aren't open. They claimed the whole mountain was open early but they don't even have all the lifts running. Not even some magic carpets, tbars or lifts operating at the bottom. They seem to open more on the wknd but that's just so packed they only allow a certain amount of people in and aren't even allowing people in that have paid for national park ticket, accom and ski passes. Really badly managed!

name: Kyle Mendes
review_text:
Missing for the 5*: decent restaurants and food, a alpine village (currently has none), more events, concerts and shows.

As reference please follow Whistler

name: Amer Zafar
review_text: My favourite snow finding place. Great for non skies families. Kids friendly toboggan area which is not available in Thredbo. Ample parking, plenty rest rooms. Kudos to all perisher workers to make it accessible to us

name: Alexander Bont
review_text: Perisher ski fields are fantastic and we have had so many enjoyable times here however, ordering tickets online is very hard and if you ever get sick and need a refund or credit it is IMPOSSIBLE to get in contact with them. You usually wait at least 20 days for each email reply and the reply is usually unfriendly and not helpful. Don't try calling them, it is impossible to get through. It is such a shame that such a nice place has such a poor customer service attitude.

name: Aariz Khan
review_text: Perfect place to go during the winter.

name: d h
review_text: If you like to have fun in the snow,then this is a good place

name: Vilaiwan Dummett
review_text: Beautiful snow

name: Gayl Crowe
review_text: I went here in winter as a novice. The weather was cold and rainy. The lesson I'd paid for was too hard for me, I'm a reasonably fit 68 year old. We had very little practice at stopping, it was very slippery, we had to walk up slope sideways over and over which was very tiring. I gave up. I still had a nice time taking photos, riding the ski tube,  having expensive coffee. The scenery is beautiful. They won't let you ride the ski lift up and down,  so I couldn't even do that.

name: paul thomas
review_text: Top place not to busy

name: Ramy Raymond
review_text: Always a great experience. Staff do their best. But I completely overwhelmed at peak times. Lessons are at ground level though they make you buy lift tickets. Lift tickets always a rip off. Take caution with everything you do. Especially the T bar lift which people tend to fly off with young children and get stuck halfway up the mountain. It's all part of the thrilling experience but take caution. I think that in future the safety will be improved.

name: Novita Tan
review_text: Nice ski resort with a lot snow equipments and cafes.

name: craig T
review_text:
The shear fact that it has 4 very different resort areas that are all Li ked by lifts (or ski tube) makes this the best Australian resort for choice of runs and terrain. It always seems to have more snow coverage than it's competitors. Plenty of 'on mountain' areas to eat to escape the larger village food court areas. Good discounts also if you get a season pass.

Be sure to get your national Park pass as rangers check car number plates every day.

Also be aware the car park fills very quickly on weekends. Ski tube from bullocks flat is always a sure thing to beat the car park issue and also saves fitting chains on snowy days.

name: Josef Winkler (Joe)
review_text:
Perisher is an amazing experience! And definitely worth the drive! Plenty of activities for everyone!
In peak times though trying to get a park cab be difficult, but that's just like any other place!

name: Natasha Chist
review_text:
The rings themselves are quite good, but everything isn't organised very well. It's a mission to send your kid off to a lesson...
I won't come back until they change their policy about ski lift passes. You have to choose exact consecutive days of purchasing a multi-day pass and no matter what the weather is it's when you have to ski! It's going to be raining next three days and we'll have to stick it up and ski in the rain or just loose our passes.
Not good enough! Resorts in New Zealand give you and two weeks your lift tickets, no questions asked. I'll go there instead.

name: Ryan Choi
review_text: Love.

name: Admin Indever
review_text: Such a gorgeous place! The resort is always buzzing and always top notch. Don't oversell your tickets or reviews will not go well. Hire more staff too

name: Terry Shiu
review_text: Great resort with beginner friendly chairlift and track. Very spacious but can get very busy on Saturday morning. Make sure to get in early to for a car spot otherwise there'll be a long walk for you

name: Danny Doan
review_text: Best place for snows in Australia. Snow guns create most of the snow and it's mostly well groomed

name: Arian Soudi
review_text: Had to go through 6 step authentication to be able to get a ski lease with no available ski lessons. Very pricey and you have to hire tubogons off site

name: Soma Deepa
review_text: Wonderful. But plan to learn skeing class before or schedule learning class so enjoy thoroughly

name: Jun Liu
review_text:
Had a lot of fun to slide with toboggan. It's free to play,  It's interesting that you can't hire a toboggan in the resort. We hired that in Jindabyne.
Need to pay national park pass fee to enter the resort, which is inside the national park.

name: Bruce Wayne
review_text: Fun  slopes and friendly staff but sadly most chair lifts  are closed due to staff shortage

name: Omer Saeed
review_text: Beautiful place with all necessary amenities. Caution for ppl with  accessibility needs, especially during snow season.

name: Every Which Way But Lost
review_text: Amazing walks in Summer and in Winter... Skiing. What's not to like

name: Luke McMahon
review_text:
There is only one word you would need to describe Perisher Ski Resort.

Beautiful.

Whoever you are that's reading this. Plan a trip there as soon as possible (preferably while there is snow). You have to experience this place.

name: Peter Pham
review_text: Great place for skiing

name: Gulnaaz Fatima
review_text:
It's was worth going .. but be careful, i would never suggest to go in the evening ... Too cold to enjoy.
It's best to see the sun-light's beauty on the classic snow .

name: Mayank Pathak
review_text: Wonder ful place to enjoy snow. I would say use snowtube to reach there

name: SMS Zaman
review_text: Parking, restaurant, halal kebab shop, toilets. Have it all. Always love Perisher.

name: Bassem zafer Fakhreddine
review_photos: [{"id":"CIHM0ogKEICAgICO1r6unAE","url":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/geougc-cs/AB3l90CKYVlzTBtZV2IMo4JOQdE9psm0NpXdh6i5T0O0A0u6MzpVkoLY5ENKjS-UfZyP-SMStSyh72MJAsTQoIgtr9Ccx0cHOG_qjcJ363V7TuGE4-EqTyzDmF1JgTFdOPtaYv-7R-O7=s1024","caption":"First time in perisha  was fun good snow  so early in the season","width":3120,"height":4160}]

name: Anand A
review_text: Beautiful experience... Visitors information center is well maintained. Hire gears, clothes, tyre chains in Jindabyne or Cooma, browse online for better deals.

name: L Chan
review_text:
Buying tickets and booking lessons on the website is one of the worst experience
One would expect that sales and service to be streamlined for any business. My friends and I have changed my mind about booking lessons or buying tickets because it's been too hard. I wonder how many others have done that...

name: Will Solis
review_text: It's great but book ahead as it can get quite crowded.

name: Deepak Dhungana
review_text: Not good because there is no light to road teritory

name: A L
review_text: It's only Autumn in May and it feels like winter. The snow already started.

name: elie
review_text: Love coming here for snowboarding

name: Muhammad hamza khalid
review_text: Best place

name: Ray Kelly
review_text: Couldn't see anything for the fog

name: Randiano Tamelan
review_text: Snow time! If you are in Sydney or Canberra, and you really want to experience a fun snow time then come to this place. It could be packed but there are always spaces for you and your loved ones to play arround. The snow is just so thick and very sophisticated. I am in love with this place! Really wish to visit again

name: Angus Stewart
review_text: better than thredbo

name: Ian M
review_text: Great place for summer riding and hiking

name: Shell Buhler
review_text: Summer in the Snowies is sensational

name: Erin Edmunds
review_text: I loved the Rock creek ski lodge, central to Kosciusko and not far from Jindabyne. The ski lodge was above my expectations, and I'll be back soon. It accommodated the 6 of us well

name: Tim Spokes
review_text: In summer the Resort is reasonably quiet and the place to stop for a picnic lunch to avoid crowds that gather at Charlottes Pass - further up the range. The carpark is quite large and mostly unpopulated, ideal to let the little ones run around for a while.

name: Hardip Singh
review_text: Went in December...so no cable cars..  no snow but many walking tracks and lookouts  ... take ur own picnic .. there is one track that is bike friendly...

name: Eric Leo
review_text: In summer, why go anywhere else if you want the best views of this gorgeous part of the world?

name: Aj
review_text: We left Sydney 9am today just to ensure we can make it to the night ski session. Arrived Jindabyne at 4:30pm and quickly had dinner. But when arrived V8 nothing was running. Lifts have closed and snow was not groomed. I instantly realised the night ski session must've been ended. We were extremely disappointed. The night ski was still running last Saturday and there is no notification or information on the website or dashboard warning us  the night ski has ended. If we knew it, we could've left sydney a lot later and had a relax trip down here. Our plan would've changed completely. The night ski has been opening every saturday for the entire season. It is 29th September today, I don't understand that if you have your day session open why couldn't keep the night session or at least highlight to your customer the dates when night sessions are available. There is no information easily spotted on the dashboard or website saying the night session has ended. Terrible experience :(

name: winz
review_text:
DO NOT BUY EPIC PASS!!!
EPIC PASS COVERAGE IS A LIE!!!
You will not be refunded even though the state was locked down and we couldn't get back without going into quarantine. This supposedly is reason enough to keep ALL of the $899.

name: Michael
review_text:
DO NOT BUY EPIC PASS!!!
EPIC PASS COVERAGE IS A LIE!!!
You will not be refunded even though the state was locked down and we couldn't get back without going into quaratine. This supposedly is reason enough to keep ALL of the $899.

name: Michelle Grogan
review_text:
I contacted customer services via the online form on the 13th June 2021.  I've  sent 2 follow up emails and messaged the team on facebook. I've  have had no reply.

The reason for contacting customer services was regarding the 9.45 Ski tube from Bullocks Flat to Perisher on Saturday 12th June.

The tube ride was a terrifying experience that was handled poorly by Perisher Ski Resort.  There was no communication from the conductor as to what was going on.  No PA system for them to communicate with us.  Children were crying and terrified.  People were confused and panicked about what was going on and what they should be doing. Smoke was filling the train and we were told the train was on fire.  It brings to the fore the questionable safety measures and emergency evacuation plans in place for the train service.

After an emergency exit we had to walk the remaining way on the train tracks with ski gear and small, crying children.

In addition, earlier that day I had to line up for 40 minutes at Bullocks Flat despite having booked everything online the prior day because the required email and QR code was not sent.

The "mountain money" offered to us late in the day is grossly inadequate, is not useful to us and in no way compensates for the experience of that morning.  It took another hour to calm down my family.  We lost an expensive half day of skiing due to the experience of the Perisher Skitube

Please respond to my emails.

name: Kiri-rii Karaka
review_text: Happiest place on earth!

name: Alice Hoang
review_text: Always a great trip. Only wish it was easier to call the office desk

name: Doc Ds
review_text: Great place to visit with plenty of areas to be away from the masses, walking up hills with 2 foot of snow is a great way to find out how unfit you are.

name: Luke Newman
review_text: Very white.

name: Josefina Lopez
review_text: Excelente e impresionante lugar
review_translated_text: Excellent and impressive place

name: Dan B
review_text: Always a pleasure to stay at the slopes, too bad we did not get a chance to visit on our annual visit due to current restrictions, but look forward to coming back soon!

name: Babu George
review_text: Wonderful experience...

name: Ben Shrimpton
review_text: No customer service or replies since June, no refunds processed - think it's likely gone / going bust

name: Santo Saunders
review_text: Perfect place. good for beginners to advanced or even just to enjoy the location! I love this place.

name: Mike Marshall

review_text: Perisher's culture is toxic. Management has a bunch of disgusting strategies pushed to staff to charge more and more and won't hesitate to lie when they are caught out. They utilise their lack of competition to strong arm people and when you complain, they tell you to shut up or go somewhere else knowing full well you have driven a very long way and have limited to no options. Appalling company with no ethics or morales. Hope covid sends this company bankrupt and another operator with some human decency will come in and take over.

name: Elly Beinhorn
review_text:
Probably the biggest ski resort with some beautiful slopes between snow gums, if you want to ski in Australia in the snowy mountains!
That's why I give it any stars at all.
The reason why the the managing company should rethink their business model:
Their prices are a complete rip off: $199/1day ski pass and only half of the lifts open is not ok.
But worse than that: in this price the public transport with the ski tube or shuttle bus is not included, so most people prefer to drive their own cars up which is absolutely counterproductive for our environment.
Not any discounts at their ticket terminals even in the peak Covid season, no half day passes or 4 out of 5-passes etc.
Pricing policy is a complete failure and no, they don't have to make their money in 3 months...other resorts worlwide are in a similar situation and they manage to offer deals in other seasons for hikers, bikers and many more potential customers.
Guess, they have to re-think their business model, anyway they won't have my money again.
Skiing in NZ or in a 5-star Switzerland skiresort is cheaper. What a pitty!

name: David Davies
review_text: I have been trying to get a refund on a epic seasons pass from Perisher costing $998 due to the lockdown but despite there being clear terms on their website for "epic coverage" that a covid lockdown is a qualifying event for a refund - Perisher arent replying to my emails and have closed down their telephone service. Non responsive.

review_text: I buggered my knee day 1 of 5. Perisher Ski Resort were super friendly and helpful in response. They guided me to the medical centre. We will definitely be back next year. But will play a little safer next time!  In the meantime, we got to enjoy camping at the snow.  Cheers Perisher!

name: Rob France
review_text:
Extremely expensive for a day in the snow. Don't mind paying the national park entry, but $190 for a day pass for adult skiing is ridiculous, add to that the exorbitant prices at the on site shops, poor quality of the facilities, and the fact that in general the staff aren't exactly friendly, I'd rather spend my money overseas and ski NZ for a whole lot less.
A week at perisher for a family of 4 would be $3200 just in lift passes, at least, then add on at least the same again for food and accommodation and you've got one expensive off-snow holiday. Staying on snow you'd double that.
The off snow ski hire places are quite reasonably priced, but on snow, you could buy for the price of a hire. 80 a day for a pair of ski pants at the resort?
The resort itself offers sort of reasonable skiing, but really, it's only just better than nothing.
NZ, the US and Canada, even Europe offer far better skiing, for a whole lot less money and much better resorts and runs. Sure there's a cost to get there, but if you are after a couple of weeks of great skiing,  don't go here.

review_text: Perisher is the best ski resort in Australia. It is the largest ski resort (was once three ski resorts, but then they all combined to create Perisher). There is ample amounts of lifts, T-bars everywhere to keep you going all day. A wide variety of greens, blue and black runs to suit everyone. Allow time to get up the skitube from the bottom, as it takes approximately 30 minutes. Lots of restaurants scattered around the resort as well! Happily return here, as it's my favourite place to ski.

Over $16 for a two portion plate of food. Chicken and vegetables. Cold.
Wouldn't go back.

review_translated_text: There are many routes to choose from

name: Mayank Mittal
review_text: What an amazing place it was and the occasion was my Birthday. I enjoyed there at the fullest with my friend. As soon as we reached snowfall started which was like Icing on the Cake for us. I will never forget this kind of birthday celebration in my life.

name: dahal sunil
review_text: Snow

name: Andrew Millar
review_text: Amazing place! Best snow in Australia, best runs, quality. Crowded in the school holidays, get in on the weekends between S. H. Morning's are best with crisp snow, sun leads to slushie snow in the arvo.

name: James Sweeney
review_text: Good amount of runs. Could use a bit of an update. Good service and friendly staff

name: William Sung
review_text: It's the snow!

name: M Hawk
review_text: Always love skiing here!

name: Noah Ahwan
review_text: What can one say... perished IS THE ONLY RESORT to snowboard at. It has terrain. Parks and staff that are second to none. Co.vid has put a dampener on things. But overall... go to perisher. It's high up. It's got so many chairlifts and yes also those awful t bars. But I love the place and always will. Thanks guys.

name: Michelle Georgeson
review_text: Pretty much perfect.....

name: Oliver Lynch
review_text:
Horrific experience purchasing tickets. Not worth elaborating.

After being rudely spoke to often by members if staff, why were the bar staff serving me drinks not wearing masks in the mid station? Couldn't be more contradicting. During this virus its unacceptable.

name: Pete C
review_text: Fantastic under new COVID rules but no problem on the slopes. Everything just worked.

name: i am seven
review_text: I enjoyed skiing every year in this resort. I only gave 3 stars bc it is incomparable to my experience in Hakuba, Japan. I hope they will put toilets at the loading areas so you dont have to go back to the restaurants to use the toilet. The food is a bit pricey esp at Mid-perisher cafe and they don't offer discount for Epic pass holders too. Recently, they have added healthier meal options for vegetarians and vegans at the main restaurants of the resort which is good. A bit busy in mid July to end of August. Some staff are helpful and friendly but most are not maybe bc they are from other countries (backpackers) working at the resort for the season...

name: Jane
review_text: Can not believe Perisher of all places doesn't take Amex. Especially when they're not taking cash!

name: Ryan Jo
review_text: Great for all skill levels. Adaquate facilities. Really enjoyed it.

name: Daniel Moore
review_text: Happiest place on earth

name: dipesh poudel
review_text: awesome

name: Domenic Cafini
review_text:
Ticket prices thru the roof...But doing a great job with covid management...snow quality very average...but  one of the lucky ones to ski this year..
All in all well done perisher

name: Hai Truong
review_text: All staff we come across have been professional, knowledgeable and especially friendly. Us being absolute newbies, staff on slopes have made us feel comfortable and encourages us to be better. Thank you for the experience!

name: vanaja devarapalli
review_text: Excellent weather but didn't spent much time because of rain

name: Anastasia Bubb
review_text:
Great resort. Many lifts available. Parking attendants. Lines move pretty quickly. Friendly staff. Opportunity to hire gear at the front of the resort. Clean.

Unfortunately, as expected at snow resorts though, food was expensive, so pack your own if you can.

name: Andy Montenegro-rigby
review_text: Masks don't work if you aren't wearing them  while you eat if your sitting with people

Awesome spot with plenty of skiing options

People are very strict here with maintaining COVID through social distancing.
Bring your mask or wear one when you are in cafe or food court

name: Nate
review_text: Love this place! Come at least once a year during the season and it never disappoints! Lots of fun for everyone.

review_text: Increible

review_text: Highly recommend getting lessons with your tickets if you are a beginner. Smiggins Holes and Thredbo are better for beginners to learn as the first slope at Perisher is steep for newbies. Take your own food, the prices are insane at the food venues on site.

review_text: Best snowy mountains experience

name: karina stafford
review_text: Bought EPIC passes for the whole family last year. Took the offer to cancel them due to no OS travel so sent email asking for refunds. So far, one deposit refunded, 2 deposits not refunded & one ticket charged full price for the season. Have tried calling & emailing multiple times with ABSOLUTELY no response. This is totally unacceptable.

review_text: So awesome to have had an Epic Pass and get on the slopes the last couple of days with the fantastic snowfall we've just just. An extra special huge big shout out to Caz and Jai who helped dig the car out after after the dump. They are both total legends.

review_text:
We purchased and payed $630 for 4 day pass  for the 15 to 18 of July We then could not get reservation for the rest of the family who purchased Epic Passes,  Perisher Resorts will not refund the money.
Totally UNFAIR.......

name: Jay Jay
review_text: Accommodation booked over a month and half  ago, looking at days for lift pass  from the 20th July , and nothing available, no updates on your website, not dates for releases no reply emails, no phone contact, you people have no idea, how do you expect people to organise there trips? Let employers know ? You people are nowhere!

review_text: Great snow, decent amount of snow making. Plenty of different skill levels catered for. Reasonable number of food choices but of course that is very expensive.

name: James Brian
review_text: Perisher changed the reservation booking date from Friday to Thursday with no notice. Lost out on reserving the weekend I had planned. I bought a season Pass and feel like I was not supported what so ever. Poor Quality Management.

name: Gui Qu Lai Xi
review_text: Very excited place.

name: Matt Curra
review_text: Unfortunately i had a trip planned and paid for in the July school holidays. Epic season passes for the family and a weeks non refundable accomodation costing many thousands of dollars. A few days before we were due to go Perisher changed their policy and decided we would have to go in an online lucky dip to get a reservation to use our season passes to ski.  We weren't lucky and only got a reservation to ski 2 out of 7 days of our holiday. Other friends going the same time with us who didn't have epic passes were able to buy ski passes for all the days. I have tried to contact Perisher to try and get help with the situation but they don't even answer the phone or emails. Its all been a horrible experience.

name: Muhammad Sohail
review_text: If you like to enjoy snowfall and white surrounding, better come in month of August... Overall a wonderful place to enjoy winters and snow. Make snow man, slide, do sking, snow fight... A day very well spent

review_text: Really fun place to snowboard for a beginner, staff were really friendly too :)

review_text: Whilst Covid has really restricted the capacity it was mother nature in 2020 that has held back a great start to the season. Only around 9 lifts open it is hard to find variety but great to be here nonetheless.

review_text: Friendly staff, high quality service and a whole lot of fun

review_text: Despite COVID 19, people are sensible,  hard a great ski trip. Instructors are fantastic,  staff are very friendly despite the pressure they work under.  Well be back soon.

name: Lo Yo
review_text: Worst experience ever. Only open 8 lifts out of 47 while limited to 50% capacity? What a joke. Already charged for expensive tickets with fewer services? So disappointed. Still can see people who are tobogganing and snowplay with no control. Even walked uphill without a lift pass.

name: Kaiser Bh
review_text: Beautiful place and really cold, stayed for about 3 days and skied like for a day was first time skiing pro tip get an instructor, and I lost count on how many times I fell. There are restaurants for food but quite expensive.

name: Qianwei Lu
review_text: We love to come back next year.

name: Marius Mc Donald
review_text: Baie lekker plek, as daar n flokkie sneeu val, val hy eerste hier. Die geriewe kan wel bietjie beter wees as jy dit met Thredbo vergelyk maar steeds verseker n besoek werd.
review_translated_text: Very nice place, if a flake of snow falls, it falls here first. The facilities could be a little better if you compare it to Thredbo but still definitely worth a visit.

name: Grant Kemlo
review_text: They are doing a great job given trying circumstances! A+

name: Tameka Giddings
review_text: An incredible place to visit! The staff are friendly and helpful as well. We can't wait to return!

review_text: Had a great time, bit unfair to be able to review though as it was opening days and only one run open. But I know the mountain has potential and would love to come back in the future

name: Petr Savchenko
review_text: Pretty old terminals

name: Matt Jones
review_text: Could not describe how poorly Perisher have approached the season this year even incorporating the disruption due to the pandemic. Treating people who payed for season passes atrociously as well as the large volume of people who don't have tickets or reservations who have non refundable accomodation. Perisher your comms team (if you even have one?!) have failed you and those of us who use to love visiting

name: Alicia Claire
review_text:
Being a season pass holder, and having booked accommodation and purchased a three day ski tube ticket with the promise that season pass holders would not be placed at disadvantage due to other customer ticket purchases; today's attempts to reserve days for my season pass (which cost $889 AUD) has been absolutely deplorable. I have spend two hours and 26 minutes online attempting to login with the items in my cart being discarded by Perishers sloppy servers many, many times, as well as having the online store close on me and other customers at least four times locking us out completely. There was no explanation of the reservation process prior to today, and there is no ability to contact Perisher by phone, email or social media. This experience so far has been absolutely woeful and of hundreds of fans on social media I have been able to find only three who have secured their reservation.
Absolutely disgraceful Perisher; you knew today was going to be busy yet to made less than the required attempts to ensure your website and customer service was even close to being acceptable.

name: Mike Schulz
review_text: Have spent $900 on a season pass and cant access the booking site, less skiing time, less benefits, same price.  Of course the website was going to crash.  Persiher have not looked after its Season Pass holders at all

name: Kevin Peng
review_text:
I wish if there was an option for zero star. The entire booking process and customer service is just appalling! The booking site constantly went down. No option to book kids lessons on the first day when I already purchased the lift passes. Then the lessons got booked out suddenly for the days of our lift passes. No option for 1 or 2 days lift passes. No response received  after online enquires sent about the lessons. Telephone is the worst, never able to speak to anyone as it keeps saying technical difficulties with phone line. So my 6 yo daughter is left with 3 days lift pass without lessons. Basically the entire place and management is a dictator. No customer service offered for help at all!

There's no link to purchase the kids lessons. I purchased the 3 day tickets from 27th/06- 29th. Could you contact me for the kids lesson please?

10 days later i finally have a absolutely unconstructive reponse which gives no help at all! Unbelieveable

"Hi

Thank you for contacting Perisher Guest Services.

You can find more information and book children's lessons here.

If you have any further questions please feel free to contact us.

Kind Regards,

Lauren

name: Craig Glanville
review_text: Great atmosphere and view , damn cold up the top

name: Jori Jalonen
review_text: Boys enjoyed in the snow, pity all shops closed, no need spending

name: Digital Garden
review_text: Make sure to bring a minimum of $200 or you won't even enjoy this place or even use the great facilities, unfortunately not sure if its worth it or not as my wallet was left a little empty in the end, best to stay longer if you do get a pass for a couple of days 2 days isnt enough

review_text: My first time experience and it was wonderful. Loved their customers service. Very tidy neat and clean

The whole weekend, accommodation, bus trip and ski gearonly cost $20!!!!, not including T-bar. That'll never happen again. Don't know how they did it. Enjoyed it, but gave up trying to ski on the first day.

review_text:
As a resort, its the biggest and most varied runs in Australia.
Food is very expensive, bland and mass produced without care, take homemade sandwiches and buy a tea.
Best accessed from BULLOCKS FLATS as the drive up or down should be avoided during bad weather.
Keep in mind it might be sunny in Jindabyne but no visibility at Perisher.....it has its own micro climate.

review_text: Expensive, but I love snow! Better to go there with a group of people so you can share the expense. Also it's a lot more fun.

name: Greg Y
review_text:
Love the place. Heaps of runs,  excellent for beginners and intermediate.
Carparking in peak season is terrible both at Perisher and Skitube, food is the usual over priced deal but that's all resorts,  otherwise I'd rate the place 5 star.

name: Ana Carolina Blanco Wahab
review_text:
Car park can be quite full during peak season. It is a good place for tobogganing and also to get the tube to got up to the hills to ski or snowboard.
Just a bit expensive to buy the tickets though, plus you need to pay to enter the kosciusko National Park. But it is a beautiful place.

review_text: Our favourite Australian ski resort

review_text: Very nice but they should indicate the colours of the trails for people to know which type trails they are in and not be there by mistake.

review_text:
Beautiful, nice open runs with lots of natural features to play on. Also lots of terrain parks.
Took 6.5 hours from Lilydale vic.
But lift tickets are beyond a joke these days! $150-$165
Parking and accommodation aren't very well thought out.

review_text: Always a pleasure to go to Perisher. Its kept clean and warm!

review_text:

review_translated_text: Beginners are advised to head directly to Blue Cow. There's a flatter practice area there, making it easier than other ski resorts.

Great trip to Perisher! Massive ski resort! So many different lifts and options for skiers or snowboarders. Loads of options for beginner to more advanced riders! Staff are all fantastic and helpful!
Weekends are alot busier! So head up mid-week for quicker lines at lifts and entire slopes to yourself!!

name: Ngaire Lyall
review_text: Had a brilliant trip to Perisher with a group of 6 and one child. It was not a busy day so there was lots of parking. Great for families with large toboggan area. A great variety of trails but had no idea where to go based on my skill level as there is no direction other than a huge and confusing map. It would be helpful to have some guides around for people new to the resort. Lots of lifts to choose from and people were really friendly here. As someone new to snowboarding I was pleased to get random advice from various people. Food was especially pricey so take your own or prepare to pay.

name: Dimas Budiyanto
review_text: Good place for ski..

name: Joseph Gullotta
review_text: Parking is a nightmare. We had to wait for a perisher bus for over 45 mins. After you pay $161 for a day ticket, this is just not a great experience. Lifts are overcrowded. Thredbo next year I think.

name: Peter Ledger
review_text:
The lifties  have gotten lazy, felt like they were actively trying to break your legs when getting on at times.
Staff in general weren't as friendly as other resorts in Oz/NZ.
Ski school for kids was haphazard with no continuity between days - i.e. different instructor each day.
Not to mention being stuck on ski tube for close to an hour one afternoon.
Apart from that, great.

name: Paul K
review_text: Really well layed out resort.  Catch the skitube up to the hill and then go exploring.  The snow is crisp and well groomed and the lifts run well.  Obviously busier on the weekends.  When buying the tickets, add the skitube straight away and save the hassle.  I recommend using the gear hire at the skitube base station, it sounds better than some of the grear being hired off hill from user / friend reports and comparisons.  Bring cash, card isn't that accepted on the hill.
